Mary is a 41-year-old woman who describes herself as industrious.  She is married to a farmer and has 4 children between the ages of 12 and 20 years old.  Mary would like to help her children obtain higher education.  

Mary operates a food vendor business, preparing and selling items such as rice, stew, yams and plantains.  She also generates income from cocoa farming.  Mary plans to use the loan to buy food ingredients like rice, plantains, yams, vegetables, spices, etc. in bulk.  She hopes to eventually expand her business and open her own restaurant.  

Mary is currently the leader of the trust bank group called 'Kristo Nti', which means “For the sake of Christ” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana. She believes that she was elected group leader because she is faithful.  There are 6 members in the group.  The other group members operate trading and food vendor businesses. They hope to receive the loan to buy more stock to grow their business and provide more support to their family.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like rice, plantains, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margret is widowed with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her sisters' children. She owns a store in Kisaasi selling charcoal and sells to all categories of people.  both  Margaret is widowed with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister's children.  She owns a store in Kisaasi selling charcoal and sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal.  Margaret doesn’t incur any transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She has been in this business for five years. Besides this charcoal business, she also sells second hand clothes. Her major customers are her neighbors. She works seven days a week. Margaret's biggest challenges are seasonality and debtors. She aspires to educate her children up to university and to start going directly to villages for charcoal. She joined MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 50 years old and married with five children between the ages of 16 and 28 years old. Three of the children are currently attending school. 

She is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for twenty years. Her main products are maize, tea and bananas, which she sells to the local market. She depends solely on the income from farming to cover the family expenses. Her main challenge in farming is lack of market and a poor transport network.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable her to pay school fees for those children still in school, and part of the milk will be used for their own consumption to improve the family's nutrition. In the future she would like to acquire three high-yielding dairy cows producing more than 15 liters of milk daily.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Enrique Rafael

texts.es: El Sr. Enrique   tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente, su conyugue se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una moto taxi el cual presta servcio de trasnporte urbano en el ambito de la ciudad, el se dedica a este negocio hace 8 años  se inicio como chofer, ellos viven en la casa de sus suegros, casa de campo, ellos tienen metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder adquirir mas vehiculos, con el dinero que solicitan invertiran en el mantenimiento de su moto taxi.
texts.en:
Enrique, 28, lives with his life partner; his spouse is a farmer. He has a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to provide passenger and cargo transportation services) with which he provides urban transportation services in the city. He has been in this line of work for 8 years; he started out as a driver. They live in their inlaws’ house which is out in the country. They have goals and objectives one of which is to own more vehicles. They will use the requested funds to for vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with five children and all her children go to school.  She resides in and owns a five-room house. Her home acts as the Center meeting place.  She owns a charcoal store at home in Kisaasi central zone and sells to all categories of people. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She buys bags of charcoal from her home and doesn’t incur any transport costs.  She has been in this business for a long time.  Sarah works seven days a week. She aspires to educate her children up to university and start investing in second hand clothes. She joined MCDT because it was helping poor women. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and five children. He has been working as a car mechanic for 28 years. He opened his auto shop in 1987. With the presence of many used and old cars in Lebanon, there is a constant need for reliable auto repair work. He has one employee who works with him full-time. All of his children also work to support the family. 

He is requesting a loan of $1000 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to invest in a machine that will help detect the carbon dioxide emission level from a car. This will be his first loan from Ameen.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to buy a machine that will detect cars' carbon dioxide emission levels

loans.name: Patao

texts.en:
Patao S. is 28 years old and single. He has been a farmer for the last eight years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for growing wheat.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan, with which he is planning to buy fertilizer and pesticide to spray his ten acres of wheat. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to acquire more farmland to meet the demand for wheat.

Patao is a young and energetic man who is determined to reach his goals. His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer for his ten acres of wheat.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year old married man from Lebanon. He is the sole income provider for his wife and child. He specializes in painting different types of wood furniture and has owned his own painting shop for 10 years. 

He is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to invest in an air spray machine to help with his work. This will be his first loan from Ameen.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in an air spray machine

loans.name: Evelyn Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 58-year-old woman who describes herself as hard-working.  She is married to a farmer and together they have six children. For the past 2 years, Evelyn has operated a food processing business where she prepares rice and stew.  She plans to use the loan to purchase 2 bags of rice, 1 carton of tinned tomatoes, and 1 gallon of oil. She hopes to continue to work hard and build a house for her family.

Evelyn is currently the leader of the trust bank group called 'Evelyn'.  It was named after the group leader. There are 8 members in this group.  The other group members are engaged in food processing businesses and petty trading. They hope to receive the loan to grow their businesses and provide more support to their family.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Ruth Mercedes

texts.es: Ruth Mercedes tiene 35 años, ella es una mujer muy responsable y además lucha por mejorar cada día su actividad económica. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio pues siempre está preocupada por sus 3 hijos que están a su cargo, Es así que viaja a la ciudad para comprar al por mayor de estos productos, para luego cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, que en la gran mayoría le hacen la compra al crédito, para luego ir de casa en casa a realizar las cobranzas respectivas. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ruth Mercedes is 35 years old. She is a very responsible woman who strives to improve her business every day. Her business is selling merchandise of all kinds. She has had this business for more than five years and uses its profits to care for her three children. She travels to the city to buy the products wholesale and fill the demands of her clients. Most of her clients buy on credit, and she later goes door to door to collect payments. She is applying for this loan to purchase more merchandise. Her wish is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Maria Rosa tiene 32 años de edad es madre soltera de una niña de 6 años  de edad, ella vive en la casa de su madre juntamente con sus hermanas menores, en el Distrito de la Tinguiña. Ella se dedica a  la venta de confitados y dulces como ambulante, ella se dedica a esta actividad  hace 3 años, Maria rosa tiene un objetivo es crecer en su negocio, con el dinerio que solicita incrementara su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria Rosa, 32, is a single mother of a six-year-old girl; she lives in her mother's house with her younger sisters in Tinguiña district. She's an itinerant sweets and candy merchant; she's been in this line of work for 3 years. Maria Rosa's objective is to have her business grow and will use the requested funds to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 60-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and five children and has been working as a taxi driver since 2005. He owns a “service” or shared taxi, which is one of the most popular and cost-effective means of transport in Lebanon. Three of his children are also working to support the household.

He is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to improve his taxi. He specifically wants to update the paint and repair some of the metal of the car’s body. This will be his second loan from Ameen.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To update the paint and repair some of his taxi's bodywork

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife, one sibling and both parents. He has been working as an electrician for 15 years and has been working independently on projects, mostly in private homes, since 2003. His wife and two other members of his household are also working to support the family. 

He is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to invest in new tools for his work. This will be his first loan from Ameen.

Note: Based on the politicA. and sociA. challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financiA. services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in new tools for his work

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is widowed with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her late sister’s children. She owns a mini-bar at home selling beer and local drinks.  She buys crates of beer from delivery vans and local drinks from Mengo Kisenyi. She incurs little transport costs from Mengo Kisenyi to her bar in Kitawuluzi. Annet sells to all categories of people but only mature ones. She wants to use this loan of 700,000/= to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local drinks and gin.  Besides this beer business, she is also a food vendor in the area. She has been doing this bar business for five years. She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include defaulters and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow big and own a fully stocked bar. She joined MCDT to acquire more capital for her business. The family has no access to electricity or piped water.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: T. Yvette est née en 1963 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à FAGBOHOUN Mathieu, un tailleur, Yvette est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Yvette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Kowégbo à Cotonou. Yvette vit dans ce quartier depuis dix sept ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Yvette n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a près de douze ans que Yvette mène comme activité la vente de condiments (tomate fraîche, oignons, poissons fumés, piments, épices, etc.) et divers autres produits dans son quartier à Kowégbo. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Yvette s'approvisionne. Yvette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Yvette ambitionne développer davantage son activité et accroître sa part de marché ; raison pour laquelle Yvette sollicite un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
T. Yvette was born in 1963 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to FAGBOHOUN Mathieu, a tailor, she is married and the mother of four children, who have all attended school.  Yvette has been living with her husband and children in the Kowégbo district for 17 years.  Together, the couple ensure that their various family expenses are covered.  Yvette has never attended school.  For almost a dozen years, she has been running a business selling condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, smoked fish, chili peppers, spices, etc.) and a variety of other goods in her district of Kowégbo.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client having already benefited from three loans, which were all repaid.  She has the ambition to develop her businesses and to grow her market share.  These are the reasons why she is requesting a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, smoked fish, chili peppers, spices) and vegetables.

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Mireya R. le está haciendo falta el vitropiso, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material ya que su esposo el señor el Lázaro Bautista.
Desean mejorar la casa donde viven ya que tiene un hijo adolescente y quieren darle lo mejor, empezando por al educación y un lugar en buen estado donde pueda vivir.
Planean pagar el crédito con una parte de los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo como guardia de seguridad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mireya R.'s home is missing floor tiles, but she does not have the money to purchase the materials. She and her husband Lazaro Bautista wish to improve their home because they have a teenage son and they want to give him a better life, starting with an education and a nice place to live. They plan on paying the loan with a part of Mr. Bautista's income from his job as a security guard.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Floor tiles to improve home

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: Martha Azucena ha trabajado mucho tiempo con Fundación y ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo ambos están estudiando con el sacrificio que ella realiza. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de costura hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella ha obtenido mucha experiencia, pues ha sido necesario para el sustento del hogar, ella tiene que estar actualizando sus revistas de confeccionar sus prendas de vestir. Con el financiamiento necesita comprar más productos al por mayor pues así podrá tener más material para sus vestidos, trajes, pantalones entre otras cosas  ella tiene muchos sueños pero le gustaría terminar de realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena has worked with the Foundation for a long time and has made full payments on time. She has two children, both of whom are studying thanks to her sacrifices. For more than eight years she has worked as a seamstress. She has a lot of experience because she has had to work to support her household. She always needs to have current magazines so that she can use them as guides for sewing different outfits. With this loan she will purchase fabric and other materials wholesale to make dresses, suits, pants, and other articles of clothing. She has many hopes for the future, but she would like to finish making improvements to her home first.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and materials for seamstress/tailor business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
A. is a 49-year-old woman who describes herself as trustworthy.  She has three adult children.  For the past 15 years, A. has sold pastries. She bakes bread and sells cake, meat pies, spin rolls and donuts.  She plans to use the loan to buy flour, margarine, vegetable cooking oil and other food ingredients in bulk to make her pastries. 

A. is on her 2nd loan, and she has proven to be a good client. She would like to continue to expand her pastry business for the benefit of her family.  She hopes that her children will eventually take over the family business.

loans.use: To purchase  food ingredients like flour, margerine, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Zinhoué

texts.fr: Née en 1960 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, H. Zinhoué est mariée à AFFADONOUGBO François. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Zinhoué vit au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une trentaine d'année. Zinhoué assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Zinhoué n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins, Zinhoué mène comme activité la vente de sandalettes et de biscuits de façon ambulante. Zinhoué achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Zinhoué mène cette activité depuis dix ans et a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé. Zinhoué rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Zinhoué sollicite à nouveau un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ms. H. Zinhoué is married to Mr. AFFADONOUGBO François. The couple have four children, who have all attended school.  Zinhoué has been living in the Sègbèya district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about thirty years.  She and her husband both ensure that the various family expenses are covered.  Zinhoué has never attended school.  To meet her different needs, she runs a business selling sandalettes and cookies door-to-door.  She buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and has been operating this business for ten years. She has already benefited from five loan from ALIDé.  She indeed repays her loans.  With the aim of bolstering her business and further satisfying customer demand, Zinhoué is requesting a new loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sandalettes and boxes of cookies

loans.name: Berrna

texts.en: Berrna is married with one child and her child goes to school. Berrna doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a bar in Kawempe selling all types of beer. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer.  She has been in this beer business for eight years and MCDT for seven years. She sells to all categories of people, but only adults. Berrna works seven days a week. Her business challenges are seasonality and defaulters.  She aspires to own a fully stocked bar. She joined MCDT because of their low interest rates. She resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Emmanuella

texts.en:
Emmanuela is a hard-working 28-year-old woman.  She is married to a farmer and together they have one child who is two years old.  Emmanuela hopes to provide her child with quality education. For the past two years, Emmanuela has been growing mushrooms, which she sells to local food retailers. She is excited to be taking out this loan to enable her to purchase mushroom seedlings in bulk and also hire more hands to expand her business and meet her customers' demand. 

Mushrooms are popularly used in preparation of local dishes like soup for fufu and various sauces. Emmanuella is pictured wearing a grey blouse and is together with her husband, her child, and her sister.

loans.use: To purchase mushroom seedlings in bulk

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr: A. Salamatou est née en 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GOUNDJE Georges, Salamatou est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Yénawa, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environs douze ans que Salamatou vit dans ce quartier. Salamatou  vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges du foyer, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Salamatou  n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis huit ans environs, Salamatou vend des chaussures au marché de Yénawa à Cotonou. Parallèlement à cette activité, Salamatou  vend également des sous-vêtements. Salamatou s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Salamatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre prêts, qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Salamatou désire rehausser le niveau de son activité pour mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle et se faire plus de revenu. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
A. Salamatou was born in 1976 in  Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to GOUNDJE Georges, she is the mother of two children, who are both in school.  The family lives in Yénawa, a district of Cotonou. Salamatou has been living in this district for about a dozen years.  She helps out her husband and, with him, ensures that the different household expenses are covered, thanks to the revenues her business brings in.  Salamatou never attended school.  For eight years, she has sold shoes at the Yénawa market in Cotonou.  Along with this work, she also sells undergarments.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Lomé, Togo.  She is a previous ALIDé client having already had four loans, which she has repaid.  She would like to raise her business level to cope with the demands of her customers and to make more income.  This is what brings her to request a fifth loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes to sell

loans.name: Nidia Isabel

texts.es: Nidia Isabel es una persona muy carismática, ella tiene 2 hijos y todos trabajan. Su actividad es venta de repostería y comida. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella se siente satisfecha por lo que ha logrado. Es jefa de su negocio y toma muy buenas decisiones, es por ello que sus ventas van mejorando además sus clientes se van satisfechos por sus deliciosos platillos. Su clave de éxito es hacer los preparativos desde las 4:00 de la mañana y su punto de venta se encuentra en su propio hogar. Este es el motivo del  financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, refrescos naturales, jugos, gaseosas, pollo, harina entre otras cosas. Ella sueña con mejorar cada día su negocio.
texts.en:
Nidia Isabel is a charismatic person. She has two children and all of them work selling desserts and food. Nidia started this business more than 13 years ago. She is satisfied with what she has accomplished. She runs her own business and makes good decisions, and because of this her sales have improved and her customers are satisfied with her delicious food. The key to her success is preparing her dishes starting at 4:00 in the morning, and she sells her products out of her home. This loan will be used to purchase supplies like different grains, juices, soda, chicken, flour, and other foodstuffs. She dreams every day of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for restaurant/bakery

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr: Monsieur Bakary F. est tailleur au marché de Dalifort. Il exerce ce  métier depuis plus de dix ans. Il gère une clientèle non négligeable  qui est composée d’habitants de Dalifort et des autres cites environnantes. Il  travaille sur commande mais aussi confectionne des habits qu’il expose et qui sont destines a la vente. Ses gains mensuels peuvent aller jusqu'à 100 000 frs ce qui lui permet d’entretenir sa famille et d’aider ses proches. Il a déjà rembourse un prêt antérieur car il est membre de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 2 ans. Monsieur F. sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs  dans l’objectif d’acheter des tissus pour la confection en  vue de renouveler son exposition. Il  souhaite agrandir son activité, améliorer ses conditions sociales et aider ses parents. Il est marie et père d’un enfant de 3 mois.
texts.en:
Mr Bakary F. has been a tailor at the Dalifort market for ten years. He manages a substantial team made up of residents of Dalifort and its surrounding towns. He makes bespoke and ready-to-wear clothes to display and sell. His monthly profits can be up to 100 000 FRS which enable him to support his family and help those close to him. He is a member of the Dalifort credit association and has already repaid a previous loan. He is seeking a 250 000 FRS loan in order to purchase fabric so that he may renew his collection. He wishes to boost his business, improve his social conditions and help his parents. He is a married father of three.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Muwanguzi Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Taking the decision to start her bar and restaurant business eight years ago seemed, at first blush, like somebody taking a leap in the dark. She was in two minds, pondering the checkered prospects that may lie ahead of her. To all appearances, N. Scovia had odds stacked against her, for the most part, owing to her modest finances. Her calling card in all this uncertainty was her sense of self-esteem. She believed she could give a good account of herself in this business.

Scovia worked incessantly hard to overcome all the problems that had manifested themselves at her business's inception. Before all this, she was into another business – selling charcoal. With persuasion from a friend, she decided to venture into something different. One and a half years later, after being prevailed upon, she took root in her bar and restaurant business.

Scovia’s down-to-earth line of conduct has won her laurels amongst her clientele. Her current financial status exemplifies how rapidly her business is growing by leaps and bounds and she earns profits amounting to 90,000 shillings a week. She also runs another business to eke out a living – a piggery.

With this loan, Scovia wants to purchase more drinks for her bar and also more food for her restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks for her bar and also more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Claudia es madre de dos hijos, desde hace cuatro años logro invertir en su propio negocio, una  pulpería y venta de cosmético con el objetivo de trabajar para cubrir gastos básicos de su familia y no solo depender de su esposo, ya que todo ah incrementado y no se ajusta solo con su salario. Con apoyo de el comenzó  a comprar  en poca cantidad y ha venido invirtiendo lo que esta contenta.

Su objetivo con este financiamiento es para lograr un mejor inventario en productos de cosméticos y productos de alimentos, para mejorar las ventas y  ganancias. Para poder invertir en su casa, y tener un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en:
Claudia is a mother of two children. Four years ago, she was able to invest in her own business, a convenience store and cosmetics sales. Her goal was to work to cover her family's basic expenses and not only depend on her husband. Everything is more expensive and he can't do it on his salary alone. With his support, she started to buy in small quantities and she been investing and is happy. Her goal with this financing is to have a better inventory of cosmetics and food products in order to improve sales and earnings. In addition, to be able to invest in her home and have better assets.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase: basic grains, dairy, snacks and cosmetics products for a better investment

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, F. Françoise vit depuis une vingtaine d'année à Gankpodo, un quartier de Cotonou. Françoise est mariée à HOUETO Adrien et est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Françoise vit à Gankpodo avec ses enfants et son mari. Françoise vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges de la famille. Pour y arriver, Françoise vend des sous-vêtements et aussi des habits pour enfants à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est aussi à Dantokpa, mais également à Lomé au Togo, que Françoise achète ses produits. Françoise mène cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année, et a déjà obtenu cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Afin d'élever le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Françoise sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un sixième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Françoise F. has lived in the Gankpodo quarter for around 20 years. She is married to Adrien Houete and is a mother of three school-aged children; she lives in Gankpodo with her children and husband, whom she helps with the family duties. To do this, she sells underwear and children's clothes at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She buys her products from Dantokpa and Lomé in the Togo. She has been involved in this trade for around ten years and has already received five loans from ALIDé, which have all been repaid. She is seeking a sixth in order to boost her business and meet her customers' demands.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothes and underwear

loans.name: La Merced (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Merced esta conformado por 9 Mujeres que luchan día a día por un mejor presente y futuro para sus hijos y se encuentran orgullosas de lo que han logrado hasta el momento, viven en la parroquia Santa Ana que se encuentra ubicada al este del cantón Cuenca, limita al norte con la parroquia Paccha, al sur con la parroquia Quingeo, al este con la parroquia Zhidmad del  cantón Gualaceo, y al el oeste  con la parroquia El Valle a una distancia de 14 km. desde la ciudad de Cuenca. Su iglesia es el principal centro turístico de la parroquia así como  “El festival de la canción” que se realiza todos los años que atrae a un gran número de visitantes de la región y otras ciudades del país.

La señora  Blanca M. se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal incentivada a ingresar a este equipo de mujeres trabajadoras  por una amiga de su comunidad,  ella se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y chanchos   que los  vende en su comunidad  sobre todo cuando tiene alguna emergencia económica. Con el  crédito que reciba va a comprar crías de pollos,  cuyes y su alimento. 

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad, enviudó  hace seis meses  porque su esposo bebía mucho, con su difunto esposo procrearon cuatro hijos que ahora  tienen 21, 18, 16 y 11 años, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente  y sólo vive con su hija de 16 años trabaja como empleada domestica y es quien le ayuda en los gastos del  hogar y  su última hija que estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, da gracias a dios porque cuenta con su casa propia herencia de su padre que falleció hace dos meses. 

Su meta ahora de realizar unos arreglos en su casita.

Fanny tiene 29 años de edad, casada y tiene dos  hijos que se  encuentran de 11 y 3 años, su primera hija estudia  en una escuela de la comunidad y el de tres pasa con ella,  vive en casa de sus suegros hasta que pueda construir su casa propia,  su esposo es  chofer de una volqueta de su propiedad y ella se dedica a la cría cuyes, pollos y chanchos que tiene tanto para el consumo en su hogar como para la venta en su comunidad. 

Es nuestra socia hace tres ciclos  invitada por su cuñada a ingresar a este gran grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas chanchos, afrechillo  y otros alimentos para su crianza.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Merced is made up of 9 women who fight day to day for a better present and future for their children. They are proud of what they have acccomplished so far. They live in the Santa Ana parish in the Cuenca canton. To the north is the Paccha parish, to the south is the Quingeo parish, to the east is the Zhidmad parish of the Gualaceo canton, and to the west is the El Valle parish. 14 km away is the city of Cuenca. Its church is the main tourist attraction of the parish, as well as “the Festival of the Song" which happenes every year and attracts a number of visitors from the region and other cities in the country. Mrs. Blanca M. is in her fourth cyle working with her community bank. She was motivated to join this group of working women by a friend from the community. She raises chickens, guinea pigs and pigs that she sells in her community, especially when she has a finanacial emergency. With the loan she receives she is going to buy chickens, guinea pigs and their feed. Our member is 46 years old. She was widowed six months ago because her husband drank too much. She had four children with her deceased husband, aged 21,18,16 and 11. Her oldest two children are married and live independently. Her 16 year old daughter is the only one who lives with her and she is a domestic worker and helps her with the household expenses. Her youngest daughter goes to school in town. Thankfully, she has her own home, inherited from her father who passed away two months ago. Her goal right now is to make some home repairs. Fanny is 29 years old. She is married and has two children who are 11 and 3. Her oldest daughter goes to a community school and the three year old stays with her. She is living in her parents-in-law's house until she can afford to build her own. Her husband drives a dump truck that he owns and she raises and sells guinea pigs, chickens and pigs for her family's own consumption and to sell in the community. She has been a member for three cycles. She was invited by her sister in law to enter this wonderful group of enterprising women. She is going to invest her loan in purchasing more pigs, food pellets and other feed to raise them.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicks, guinea pigs, pigs, food pellets and other feed to raise the animals.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan R. B. es de profesión constructor de obra, lleva trabajando muchos años en esta profesión, su señora en ama de casa, los dos son muy trabajadores y vive en una casa alquilada en el barrio IPVU.
El tiene una familia muy humilde pero con muchas ganas para el trabajar actualmente quieren comenzar a trabajar en la venta de pescado y para ello solicitan su destino del crédito fue para la compra de un freezer con el cual empezara a realizar venta de pescados.
texts.en:
Juan R. B.'s profession is construction worker; he's been in this profession for many years; his wife is a housewife. Both are very hard-working and live in a rented house in the IPVU (Instituto Provincial de Vivienda y Urbanismo-Provincial Housing and Urban Planning Institute) neighborhood. His is a very humble family but with a strong will to work and they would like to start selling fish. To do so, they need funds to buy a freezer with which to start their fish sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Love Jesus Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Diana is a 45-year-old woman who describes herself as a good leader.  She is married to a farmer and has 9 children between the ages of 10-26.  Diana would like to provide her children with a university level education.

For the past 4 years, she has made and sold “kenkey.”  “Kenkey,” a traditional Ghanaian food, is a maize-based starchy ball that is usually eaten with pepper and fried fish.  Diana will use the loan to buy 2 bags of maize, 2 cartons of fish, and vegetables. Diana would like to expand her business by providing her “kenkey” to more people in her town as well as neighboring towns.

Diana is currently the leader of the trust bank group called 'Love Jesus'.  There are 6 members in this group. The other group members operate various food processing and trading businesses. They hope to receive the loan to enable them to grow their business and be able to provide more support to their families.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like maize, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane S. est un homme de 52 ans qui habite dans la localité de Dalifort.
Il est  menuisier depuis plus de 10 ans. Il fait des meubles des portes et des fenêtres pour des particuliers surtout des émigrés qui ont des maisons en construction. Il a des clients partout. Il emprunte 200 000 frs pour terminer ses commandes et aussi fabriquer  quelques meubles pour les exposer. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants  et c’est avec ses revenus qui peuvent être estimes a plus de cent milles franc Cfa par mois qu’il entretien sa famille, paie la scolarité de ses enfants et subvient à ses besoins. Monsieur S. a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur au sein de l’institution ou il est membre depuis 5 ans. Ce prêt lui permettra de terminer  ses commandes et d’entamer d’autres marchés. Son rêve est d’acquérir ultérieurement une machine pour augmenter ses revenus pour mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Souleymane S. is 52 years-old and lives in the town of Dalifort. He has been a carpenter for over 10 years and makes furniture, doors and windows for private customers, mostly emigrés who are building their homes, and has a large customer base. He is seeking a 200 000 FRS loan in order to complete his orders and also to make some furniture items to put on display. He is a married father of three and aims to use this revenue, estimated at around 100 000 FCFA per month in order to see to his family's needs and pay for his children's schooling. Mister S. has already received a loan from the credit association of which he has been a member for over 5 years. This loan would enable him to complete his orders and enter other markets. His dream is to purchase a machine which would enable him to generate higher revenues, thereby helping him to meet his family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 37-year-old mother of two who lives with her family in San Rafael, San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. She has been a client of Fundacion Mujer over the past twelve years, utilizing loans to finance her various entrepreneurial activities.

The loan consultant who has been working with Nancy over the years describes her as an organized, dedicated, hardworking and independent entrepreneur with a fighting spirit. In the past, Nancy has experienced difficulties making repayments on time. The loan consultant says that now, with Nancy’s mother helping to take care of her children, Nancy will have more time to dedicate to her business and struggle less to make repayments.

Nancy has a business selling various products including jewelry, clothing and perfumes to members of her community. This loan will be used specifically to finance the purchase of perfumes and colognes which she plans to sell at a 50% profit margin. Her most expensive perfumes sell for 100,000 colones (approximately 180 USD).

Nancy spends all day Saturday dedicated to her business, making sales and collecting payments. Throughout the week, clients pass by Nancy’s house to make purchases; if she isn’t around, her mother will make the sale. Nancy acts as a supplier to her husband, who sells products to his customers (he drives a taxi as well), and to her cousin who sells products at her high school.

For her perfume-selling activity, Nancy´s sister has put her in touch with a supplier in Alajuela, the neighbouring province to San Jose, where Nancy hopes to secure a good price for some perfumes in order to increase her income. She says her most popular products are her least expensive perfumes.

Although she has only a high school education, Nancy has proven herself as an adept businesswoman. Her goal is to open a type of bazaar in her house where customers could peruse the various product she has to offer.

Nancy says her main obstacle is working capital but she also sometimes has trouble collecting payments from new clients. To address this issue, She tends to keep a closer eye on newer clients, allowing them longer pay periods and the purchase of more expensive products on credit only as the clients prove they are trustworthy.

At the moment, business is good. Nancy is making a good amount of sales and her client base is growing.

loans.use: To finance the purchase of more perfumes and colognes

loans.name: Kasanja Basooka Kwavula, Mubende Group

texts.en:
At the top left in the small photo is K. Isaaya, the group leader. He also appears in the group photo.

A determined and very hard working K. Isaaya, aged 47 years, is the married father of ten children and three helpless dependents. He has operated a retail shop business for sixteen years in Kibutamu, Mubende District, selling general merchandise. At the end of every week he is able to pocket profits to the tune of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from his shop and 150,000 shillings from farming.

Isaaya’s main drawback has been having a small amount of stock in his business that cannot match the consumption rate of his customers. He is therefore seeking a loan that he figures will help him stock more goods to satisfy his customers’ high demand and also transform his enterprise into a wholesale business in future.

Being very committed to his business, with good customer care, Isaaya hopes to increase his sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in his business and enable him to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for his family’s requirements.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his store

loans.name: Carlos Ruperto

texts.en:
Carlos, 60, is married, has 2 children, Luis (10 years) and Miguel (8 years) and lives with his wife in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra). He is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops.

Carlos is a farmer. He purchases and sells his goods in Bucay every 3 months. He requests this loan so that he can plant more crops. His goal is to continue to labor land. Carlos works 7 days a week to help his family.

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Gounadon

texts.fr: GOUNADON L. L. est née le 19 Octobre 1964 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. L. L. est mariée à DASSI Damien, un comptable. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a près de treize ans que L. L. vit au quartier Suru-Léré à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. L. L. vit en effet dans ce quartier ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges familiales. L. L. a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, puis a appris la couture, une activité qu'elle exerce depuis vingt ans et qu'elle continue d'exercer. Parallèlement, L. L. vend des oeufs, du sucre en poudre et de l'eau "Pur Water" à son domicile. L. L. achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de L. L. augmente au jour le jour et L. L. n'arrive plus à tous les satisfaire compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. C'est donc pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que L. L. sollicite un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
L. L. GOUNADON was born on 19th October 1964 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Damien DASSI, an accountant. The couple has four children who are all at school. For almost 13 years L. L. has been living in the Suru-Léré district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Indeed, she lives in this district together with her children and husband. The couple share the different household expenses between them. L. L. left school during secondary school and then learned how to sew. She has been carrying out this activity for the past twenty years and continues to do so. At the same time, she sells eggs, caster sugar and "Pur Water" water from home. She buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She is an old client of ALIDé, having already had three loans which have all been repaid on time. L. L.'s customer base is growing all the time and she cannot satisfy all the demand, since her financial means are meagre. She is requesting a fourth loan in order to increase her working capital and to be able to satisfy customer demand more readily.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trays of eggs, caster sugar and sachets of water

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Madame Khoudia F. est sociétaire de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 5 ans. Elle est âgée de 30 ans et habite dans le quartier de Darou Salam. C’est une ménagère, mariée et mère de 4 enfants et elle s’active dans la vente de pain et de petit déjeuner  devant chez elle au profit des maçons et travailleurs qui sont dans les environs. Elle capitalise une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce petit commerce. Ses bénéfices  peuvent  varier en moyenne entre 500 et 1000 frs CFA journalièrement, ce qui lui permet de participer a la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Aussi ce prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son fond de commerce et faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khoudia F. has been a shareholder-member of the savings bank in Dalifort for the past five years. She is 30 years old and lives in the district of Darou Salam. She is a housewife, married and mother to four children. She sells bread and breakfasts in front of her home, to builders and workers in the surroundings. She has more than five years' experience in this small business. Her profits can vary on average between 500 and 1000 francs a day, which allows her to participate in the management of the daily expenses. This loan will allow her to increase her business and meet her customers' needs. She is requesting a loan of 75,000 francs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Nyaruhanda Twimukye, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
K. Wily, aged 45, is hardworking and dedicated to his farming business where he deals in a variety of farm aspects that include a banana plantation enterprise and animal rearing. He has been doing this for over fifteen years and it has earned him a profit of 200,000 Ugandan shillings monthly that has helped in providing basic needs for his children and family as well as business expansion.

This loan will be of great value for Wily to purchase farm tools like hoes, fertilizer and to modernize his plantation to improve on his banana crop (which is commonly used by customers for making a local dish). He will also be able to buy pesticides for the pests and diseases which are a great threat to his business products. This will increase his sales revenue and enable him to pay his daily bills including his children’s school bills.

Wily belongs to a group of members who hold each other accountable and insure one another in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase pestcides and other farm tools

loans.name: Iván Alfredo

texts.es:
Iván Alfredo U. Lazo tiene 41 años de edad y vive con su mujer e hija de casi  3 años, Evelyn. 
Ellos viven en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.  Iván es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios 

Iván se dedica al transporte de personal, es un chofer profesional, por mediodía y la otro parte del día es agricultor, criando porcinos. El compra sus productos en centros agrícolas, tiendas y mercados, en los mismos lugares donde compra lo que los porcinos necesitan.

Iván solicita el crédito para dar mejor mantenimiento a su negocio y ser mejor. Su sueño es mejorar su nivel de vida, tener un futuro mejor y competir con los demás. Sus desafíos son la lucha constante para bien vivir y la competencia que existe hoy en esta crisis. 

Iván quería dar gracias a la Cooperativa San Jose para darle la oportunidad de encontrar crédito. 
A Iván le gusta hacer deportes.
texts.en:
Iván Alfredo U. Lazo is 41 years old and lives with his wife and his daughter Evelyn, who is almost 3 years old. They live in Chillanes Canton, Bolivar Province. Iván is a member of the Santa Rosa de Agua Clara rural loan group, located 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 15 group members, most of whom have their own small businesses. Iván works in passenger transport as a professional driver half the day, and the other half of the day he tends to the pigs on his farm. He buys his products in agricultural centers, stores and markets, in the same areas where he buys what his pigs need. Iván is requesting this loan to improve and maintain his business by buying products for his pigs. His dream is to improve his quality of life, improve his future and compete with others in the same line of work. The main challenges he faces are the constant struggle to live well and the high level of competition that exists during the current economic crisis. Iván wanted to thank Cooperativa San José for giving him the opportunity to take out this loan. He enjoys playing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy products for his pigs

loans.name: Bufunda Garage, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
M. Muzamira, aged 38 years, has a family of three and has been operating a bicycle repair shop for two years in Nyabuhikye, Ibanda. Through doing this he is able to make 160,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis which he uses to meet his family’s daily requirements including buying food for the family and paying tuition fees.

For a long time, Muzamira’s motive has always been to set up a spare-parts shop as there is a ready market available. This would help him to better progress his mechanic’s job more fairly with the extra expense of purchasing machines from other people but the ability to earn more profit.

Therefore, with this loan, Muzamira hopes to buy more spares for repairing bicycles.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle spare parts and open up a shop

loans.name: Tatiana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Tatiana Elizabeth C. L. tiene 21 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos: Mario (5 años) Yahaira  (1 año). Ellos viven en Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar
Tatiana es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios
Tatiana tiene un almacén pequeño de ferretería. Un agente vendedor la visita mensualmente para darle los productos que necesita para vender. Tatiana solicita el préstamo para engrandecer un poco más su  negocio. Su sueño es tener todo que el cliente le venga a comprar.
Los desafíos que ella enfrente son salir adelante en la familia y hacer prosperar su negocio. Su marido trabaja de mecánico, su hijo estudia en la escuela Gran Colombia y ella cría su hija.



Tatiana is 21 years old, married and has 2 children: Mario, who is 5 and Yahaira who is 1. They all live in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra)
Tatiana is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops.
Tatiana has a small shop of hardware. A salesman visits her every month to provide her with the goods she needs to sell. Tatiana is requesting this loan to enlarge a bit her small shop. Her dream is to have all goods the clients ask for.
She faces challenges to succeed with her family and have her business grow. Her husband works as a mechanical, her son goes to the “Gran Colombia” school and she raises her daughter.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 21 years old, married and has 2 children: Mario, who is 5 and Yahaira who is 1. They all live in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra) Tatiana is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara” rural communal bank, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in all; most of whom have small shops. Tatiana has a small hardware shop. A salesman visits her every month to provide her with the goods she needs to sell. Tatiana is requesting this loan to enlarge a bit her small shop. Her dream is to have all the goods the customers ask for. She faces challenges to succeed with her family and have her business grow. Her husband works as a mechanic, her son goes to the “Gran Colombia” school, and she raises her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make her hardware business a bit larger

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane F. exerce l’activité de tôlier depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est surtout spécialisé  dans la tôlerie en  peinture automobile. Ses occupations les plus régulières concernent  la réfection, la peinture et l’embellissement des véhicules. Et c’est une activité qu’il a choisi par amour. Monsieur F. est âgé  de 52 ans, il habite dans la banlieue de Dalifort et est sociétaire de la caisse depuis déjà 6 ans. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000frs destine a l’achat de produits qu’il utilise dans son activité, tels que peinture, vernis, etc.  Il se réjouit du fait qu’il est de plus en plus sollicite dans les services qu’il offre a la communauté. Ainsi  le nombre moyen de véhicules qui lui est propose pour la peinture dépasse facilement 10  et il peut gagner 100 000 frs par mois. Par conséquent ses revenus lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et à s’occuper de sa famille. Il a déjà rembourse un prêt antérieur et ce dernier pourra l’aider à honorer ses engagements  envers la clientèle, a améliorer son travail et a renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane F. has been working in an auto body shop for over ten years. He specializes in auto painting. His typical activities include auto body work, painting and cosmetic repairs. This is an occupation that he had chosen because he felt attracted to it. Mr. F. is 52 years old; he lives in a suburb of Dalifort and has been a mutual fund member for six years already. He is seeking a credit of 100,000 West African Francs in order to purchase supplies needed for his work, such as paint, polish etc. He is happy that the popularity of his shop in the community has been steadily growing And thus in an average month, the number of cars he has to paint can reach 10 and more, and he can earn 100,000 West African Francs per month. In this way, he earns an income allowing him to take care of his own needs and to provide for his family. He already repaid a previous loan; the new loan would help him keep his commitments to the customers, enhance his work and strengthen his business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering business capital

loans.name: Bernadette A.

texts.fr: D. Bernadette A. est née le 18 Avril 1965 et vit depuis trente ans environs au quartier Lom-Nava à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Bernadette est mariée à KOUNNOUHO Emmanuel, un tailleur, et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Bernadette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les charges familiales. Bernadette n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins et nourrir sa famille, Bernadette vend des tissus et également des ustensiles de cuisine (plats, bols en séries, etc.) par le système de distribution. Bernadette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Bernadette exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans environs et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé. Ces différents crédits ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'accroître sa part de marché, afin de se faire plus de revenu, Bernadette sollicite un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Bernadette A. D. was born on April 18, 1965. For about the last thirty years, she has been living in the Lom-Nava district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Emmanuel Kounnouho, a tailor, and is the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. Bernadette lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the family budget together. Bernadette attended only primary school. In order to be able to provide for herself and her family, she sells fabrics as well as kitchenware (dishes, sets of bowls etc.) through the local distribution system. Bernadette purchases her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for about four years and had already obtained three loans from ALIDé in the past. All past loans have been duly repaid. In order to bolster her business and expand her market share, and to increase revenues in this way, Bernadette is seeking a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing kitchenware (dishes, bowls, etc) and fabrics for resale

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Señor Luis B. M. es casado desde hace varios años, y vive en su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio San Miguel distrito de Cambyreta. Tiene varios hijos pero ya todos independientes, quienes les ayudan económicamente.

El señor Luis se dedica a realizar servicios de Taxi desde hace varios años, el tiene su vehículo propio con el cual realiza su actividad. Además el trabaja como sereno de un Hotel. Mediante estas actividades que realiza el puede mantener su hogar y solventar los gastos que se le presenten. Algunos de sus hijos actualmente están trabajando en España, los cuales le ayudan enviándole dinero de forma mensual. 

El hoy día está solicitando el crédito para el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que cada seis meses lo realiza para que siempre este en optimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Luis B. M. has been married for several years. He lives in his own house, which is located in the San Miguel neighborhood in the Cambyreta district. He has several children, but they are all independent. They help them economically. Luis has been providing taxi service for several years. He has his own vehicle to do this activity. He also works as a night watchman for a hotel. Through these activities he is able to support his household and pay the expenses they have. Some of his children are currently working in Spain. They help by sending him money on a monthly basis. He is now requesting a loan for maintenance on his vehicle. He does this every six months so that it is always in optimal condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es:
María Inés B. B. tiene 54 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus 2 hijas, Luisa (17 años)  Isabel (24 años).  Ellas viven en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

María Inés es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios

María Inés tiene un negocio de comidas (almuerzos,meriendas,etc) y compra sus productos cada fin de semana en Bucay. Solicita el crédito para incrementar su restaurante. Su sueño sería que su negocio siga creciendo. 

A María Inés le gusta pasar el tiempo en familia cuando no trabaja. Su hija, María Isabel, también solicita un préstamo para su propio negocio.
texts.en:
María Inés B. B. is 54 years old, single, and lives with her two daughters: Luisa (17) and Isabel (24). They live in the Chillanes Canton of Bolivar Province. María Inés is a member of the Santa Rosa de Agua Clara rural loan group, which is located two hours from Chillanes. There are 15 group members in all, most of whom have their own small businesses. María Inés has a business selling meals (lunches, dinners, etc.) and buys the products she needs each weekend in Bucay. She is requesting this loan to buy more ingredients for her restaurant. Her dream is for her business to continue to grow. María Inés enjoys spending time with her family when she is not working. Her daughter, María Isabel, is also requesting a loan for her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Kigarama Tukore, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
With hard work and high self-esteem, A. Joseph has tried, beyond limits, to maintain his general produce store that he has been operating since 2000 in Kigarama Trading Centre, Ibanda.

Being one of the most active types of business here in Uganda, especially in the western part where Joseph comes from, many entrepreneurs have tried to invest in it; Joseph is among the lucky ones benefiting from it. With this loan, he hopes to be able to purchase more stock for his business and also be in position to transform his business into a more commercial one, thus improving his profits. He needs a loan to be able to buy more agricultural produce to sell.

Joseph is in a group with other members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To restock his business with more agricultural produce

loans.name: Immacule

texts.en:
Immacule is 50 years old, married with 9 children.  Immacule is commonly known in the business of sewing clothes.  In this business, she employs 5 people from her community as helpers.  So as those employees help her to earn more profits, Immacule is still in the lack of the equipments.  Immacule usually runs her business from 7 am until late in the evening. 

Immacule is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more equipments including clothing items, additional sewing machines, etc.  With the use of this loan, Immacule will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will help her to sort out her family problems.  In addition, she will keep reinvesting for a better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase clothes so that she can make more clothes

loans.name: Lucrecia Evangelina

texts.es:
Lucrecia G.  se dedica a realizar ropa artesanal y bordados actividad que desempaña desde hace cinco años. En sus inicios según comento realizaba media docena de batas las cuales vendía en el mercado de Masaya  pero poco a poco con el trabajo arduo  en familia y los préstamos  su negocio  creció. 
Actualmente distribuye su línea de ropa en Managua, Catarina, Masaya, Granada, León  Jinotepe y  tiene su propia tienda en el mirador de Catarina meta que tenia y que cumplió gracias al crédito y al apoyo de sus cuatro hijos de 21, 20, 19 y 17 años los cuales estudian  y  en sus tiempos libres trabajan junto con ella.
G. invertirá el crédito en telas, hilos, cintas y otro tipo de materia prima para confeccionar sus modelos un ejemplo de su trabajo es el que muestra en la foto.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Gonzalez has been making clothes and embroidery for five years. She tells us that she started with a half dozen robes, which she sold in the Masaya market. Little by little her business grew with the family’s hard work and the loans. She currently distributes her line of clothing in Managua, Catarina, Masaya, Granada, León, and Jinotepe. She has her own store in Mirador de Catarina. This was her goal, and she achieved it thanks to the loan and the support of her four children. They are 21, 20, 19, and 17. They go to school, and they work with her during their free time. Lucrecia will use the loan to by fabric, thread, ribbons, and other types of materials to make her designs. An example of her work is shown in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabrics and thread, etc.

loans.name: Jaime Leonardo

texts.en:
Jaime is 24 and lives with his grandparents in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra).

Jaime is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops. Jaime has been working as a salesman in a supermarket for more than 6 years. He purchases his products in a wholesale store. He requests this loan to buy pigs. His objective is to expand his small farm.

With this loan, he hopes to make progress towards achieving the goals he has set for himself.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: D. Marguerite est née en 1969 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ZINSOU Sévérin, Marguerite est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais deux des enfants ne sont plus à la charge du couple. La famille vit au quartier N'Vènamèdé à Cotonou, depuis près de 15 ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Marguerite vend des jus de fruits (jus de citron, de bissap, etc.) dans une école située au quartier Suru-Léré à Cotonou. De façon secondaire, Marguerite vend également de la bouillie (faite à base d'amidon de maïs). Marguerite achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Marguerite exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et avait obtenu antérieurement trois prêts de ALIDé, prêts qu'elle a tous remboursés. Marguerite a connu entre temps une situation de mévente, et veut à présent renforcer son activité et accroître sa part de marché. C'est pour cette raison que Marguerite sollicite un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Marguerite D. was born in 1969 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Sévérin Zinsou, Marguerite is the mother of six children, all of whom are at school. But two of the children are no longer with the couple. The family has lived in the N’Venamede district of Cotonou for almost 15 years. Both she and her husband take care of the family expenses. To meet her needs, Marguerite sells fruit juice (lemon juice, hibiscus juice, etc.) at a school in the Suru-Léré district of Cotonou. As a secondary business, Marguerite sells “bouillie” (a type of porridge made from corn starch). Marguerite buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Marguerite has been running this business for about 10 years and has previously obtained three loans from ALIDé, all of which she repaid. Marguerite has since experienced a drop in sales and now wants to boost her business and take a bigger share of the market. This is why Marguerite is requesting a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, hibiscus, lemons, etc. to make fruit juice

loans.name: Zoila Graciela

texts.en:
Zoila is 44 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of Chillanes in the Province of Bolivar with her husband and three children, whose names are Tatiana (21), Luz Angelica (16) and Fatima (9). Zoila is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops.

Zoila sells assorted clothing. She purchases the items in Guayaquil and Ambato and sells them in the surroundings of Bucay. She is requesting this loan to increase her stock. Her desire is to have in her shop all her clients need and thus increase her income. She hopes everything will go well with her business to be able to help her mother and children.

On a typical day, she wakes up very early, makes coffee, sends her children to school, then prepares lunch ahead of time. At 9am she opens her business, and she works all day. Her husband is currently working abroad.

loans.use: Buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Concepción Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Concepción del Socorro C. G., tiene la edad de 52 años es madre soltera de 2 hijos mayores de edad que actualmente trabajan  y le apoyan a su madre con los gastos domésticos en los que se incurre mensualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 6 años.

Dada la crisis económica por la que atraviesa el país, las tienda  de ropa de segunda mano en Nicaragua han tenido gran éxito, razón por la cual la motivo al ver esta demanda, en invertir poco a poco con sus ganancias de costura e ir adquiriendo mercadería, ahora desea adquirir a futuro en la compra de un perchero para guindar las prendas y ofrecer la mercadería con un mejor orden, por ahora lo que la tiene con mucho afán es la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar unas reparaciones en su hogar que le permitan una mejor comodidades y la tranquilidad de dejarles a sus hijos un hogar digno y con condiciones cómodas en donde habitar con sus familias. Es por esta razón que solicita  un préstamo la iniciación a las remodelaciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Concepción del Socorro C. G. is a 52 year old single mother. Her children are grown, and they currently work. They help their mother with the monthly household expenses. She has been selling used clothes for six years. Due to the economic crisis throughout the country, second hand clothing stores have been very successful in Nicaragua. Upon seeing this demand she was motivated to invest her earnings from sewing, little by little, in getting merchandise. She would now like to get a clothes rack to hang the clothing and offer her merchandise in better order. She is now eager to buy construction materials to make some repairs in her home. These will provide more comfort and the tranquility of leaving her children a decent home. She wants to leave them a home with comfortable conditions where they can live with their families. She is requesting the loan to start renovations on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations on her house

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 41 años  de edad es conviviente, no tiene carga familiar. Ella se dedica como empleada del hogar  prestando servcios demesticos, trabajando actualmente en los Viñedos de Santa Maria,  ella viene laborando hace 3 años  consecutivamente en la misma casa. Su conyugue es chofer de automovil tico el cual alquila. Ellos tiene un objetivo el cual es poder adquirir un terreno para  poder construir su casa, con el dinero que solicita sera para completar para la compra de un terreno.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old, lives with her life partner and has no dependents. She works as a domestic employee in private homes; she's currently employed at the Santa Maria vinyards and has worked continuously for the last three years in the same house. Her spouse drives a Tico automobile; he leases out its services. Their goal is to acquire a lot on which to build their house; the requested funds will complete the amount they need to buy it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Lydia Marie-Louise

texts.fr: H. Lydia Marie-Louise est née le 05 Août 1954 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SOSSOU Jean, Marie-Louise est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Seulement, deux des enfants sont encore à la charge de Marie-Louise et de son mari. Il y a près de trente ans que Marie-Louise s'est installée au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, où elle vit avec sa famille. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Marie-Louise a très peu fréquenté. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Marie-Louise vend de la glace, du jus de bissap, du yaourt, de sucette dans sa boutique située à son domicile. Parallèlement, Marie-Louise vend également de la bouillie faite à base d'amidon de maïs, et aussi des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Marie-Louise s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Marie-Louise exerce cette actvité depuis quinze ans et a obtenu déjà cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé. Marie-Louise a bien remboursé ses prêts. Marie-Louise a connu dans le passé, quelques difficultés financières et désire rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux  satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pour ce faire que Marie-Louise sollicite un sixième prêt.
texts.en:
Lydia Marie-Louise H. was born on August 5, 1954 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Jean Sossou, Marie-Louise is the mother of five children, all of whom have attended school. Just two children are still in the care of Marie-Louise and her husband. Almost thirty years ago Marie-Louise settled in the Ayélawadjè district of Cotonou, where she still lives with her family. She and her husband share the household expenses. Marie-Louise received very little schooling. To meet her expenses, she sells ice, hibiscus juice, yoghurt and ice pops out of a shop in her home. At the same time, she sells “bouillie,” a type of porridge made from corn starch, and telephone calling cards. Marie-Louise gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She has been running this business for 15 years and has already obtained five loans from ALIDé. Marie-Louise repaid all her loans in full. Marie-Louise has had some financial difficulties in the past and wishes to boost her business to better satisfy customer demand, This is why Marie-Louise is requesting a sixth loan.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn to make bouillie, and sugar, hibiscus, etc. to make fruit juice

loans.name: Víctor Alejandro

texts.es:
Víctor Alejandro F. G. tiene 52 años de edad  es casado y tiene una hija, Aina de 7 años. Ellos viven en el cantón de Chillanes, en la provincia de Bolívar

Víctor es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios

Víctor es sargento primero de la comisión de transito de Guayas, y también tiene su propio negocio de viveres. Realiza las compras y las vendas en el cantón Bucay. Víctor solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio.

Por el momento, no encuentra desafíos mayores en la familia o el negocio
texts.en:
Víctor Alejandro F. G. is 52 years old and married; he has one daughter, Aina, who is 7 years old. They live in Chillanes Canton, Bolivar Province. Víctor is a member of the Santa Rosa de Agua Clara rural loan group, located 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 15 group members, most of whome have their own small businesses. Víctor is a sergeant in the Guayas Transportation Commission, and also has his own grocery store. He buys and sells his products in Bucay Canton. He is requesting this loan to buy more grocery items. Víctor does not currently face any great challenges with his family or his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy more products for grocery store

loans.name: Lolita Del Socorro

texts.es:
