Lolita del Socorro U. D.  de 33 años desde muy temprano sale a la carretera los altos a vender frutas como sandilla, melón, papaya, elotes, jocote, mango, coyolito y piña entre otras. Negocio que inicio desde hace seis años y en el que le ayuda su hijo mayor de 15 años después de clases.
Ella con el crédito comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de frutas para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Lolita del Socorro U. D. is 33 years old. She leaves very early for the Los Altos road to sell fruits like watermelon, melon, papaya, beans, jocote, mango, palm fruit, and pineapple, among others. She started the business six years ago. Her oldest child, who is 15, helps her after classes. She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity and variety of fruits so that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seasonal fruits

loans.name: Maximo Alexi

texts.es: Maximo   tiene 38 años de edad es soltero vive en la casa de su madre, casa de material de adobe de un piso, el vive  juntamente con su hermana. El se dedica actualmente como ayudante de cocina para el restaurante cevicheria  “El Remo”, el biene laborando hace 2 años. El es una persona joven activa con muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener un negocio propio ya sea de venta  de comida u otro. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en algunos arreglos  de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maximo is 38 years old. He is single and lives in his mother's home, a one-story adobe house. His sister also lives there. Maximo works as a kitchen assistant in "El Remo" ceviche restaurant; he has been working there for two years. He is a young, active person with many dreams, and one of them is to have his own business, whether it is in food sales or another area. With the money he asks for, he will invest in some repairs for his mother's house.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Bertille

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Dangbo, dans le département de l'Ouémé, M. Bertille est mariée à KPOVIESSI Firmin, et est mère de trois enfants. Il y a environs vingt ans que Bertille s'est installée au quartier Yénawa à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Bertille vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Bertille n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Bertille vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, sucre, conserves de sardine, lait, savons,  thé, allumettes, etc.) à son domicile. Bertille achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Bertille exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et a déjà bénéficié de trois prêts à ALIDé, prêts qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Bertille désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et élever le niveau de son activité pour mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est pour cette raison que Bertille sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Dangbo, in the Ouémé department, Bertille M. is married to Firmin Kpoviessi and has three children. About twenty years ago Bertille settled in the Yénawa district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and still lives there with her children and husband. Bertille helps her husband take care of the family expenses. Bertille never attended school. To meet her needs and those of her children, Bertille sells a variety of products (pasta, sugar, canned sardines, milk, soap, tea, matches, etc.) out of her home. Bertille buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She has been running this business for about 10 years and has already obtained three loans from ALIDé, all of which she repaid. Bertille wishes to increase her working capital and boost her business so that she can better satisfy the requirements of her customers. This is why she is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy misc. products (pasta, canned food, sugar, soap, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
María B. de 40 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, tiene un hijo de 6 años,  por la falta de oportunidades tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en ropa y venderlas a sus amigos. Poco a poco fue teniendo un ritmo de dinero estable para mantener a su hijo. 

Con esfuerzo y dedicación ella ha estado vendiendo ropa ambulantemente por todo Guayaquil, reparte la ropa a varios clientes desde las 08h00 hasta que termine de repartirla, vende las blusas a $ 10.00, las faldas a $ 6.00. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas ropa como pantalones, camisetas para venderlas a sus clientes y tener mas ingresos. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local para la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
María B., 40, lives in a periurban area along Guayaquil’s beltway; she has a six-year-old son. Due to the lack of employment opportunities, she had to use her savings to buy clothes to resell to her acquaintances. Gradually she began to have a steady income to support her son. With effort and dedication she has been selling clothing throughout Guayaquil. She starts her work day at 8am and continues until she distributes all of it. She sells blouses for $10.00, skirts for $6.00 She will use the loan to buy more clothes like pants and shirts to sell to her customers thereby earning more income. She’d love to have a locale in which to sell her clothes in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For pants and shirts.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 56 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, que vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Justa de 52 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Con el apoyo de su esposa, Alejandro decidió comprar, hace 35 años, unos terrenos en los cuales pudiera trabajar y así mejorar la economía de su familia. Actualmente esos terrenos los sigue trabajando, pero ahora son mucho mas productivos que antes, ya que con el paso del tiempo aprendió  a obtener la mayor producción de sus chacras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación tan cercana que tiene con la tierra, además disfruta mucho viendo sus sembríos crecer, lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus campos de las inclemencias del clima, ya que cualquier descuido puede afectar la cosecha. Para más adelante, espera que los costos de las verduras suban, ya que de lo contrario su capital de trabajo se vera afectado.Este es el quinto préstamo que Alejandro tiene con MFP; esta muy contento por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesitaba  urgentemente para mejorar su negocio. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que siempre pone mucho orden en las reuniones.Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para fortalecer sus sembríos, y  también invertirá en la compra de ganado.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 56 years old. He is a hard working and responsible husband and father who lives in his own home with his wife, Justa, 52, and their 3 minor children to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. With his wife's support, Alejandro decided, 35 years ago, to buy some plots of land in which to work and thus improve his family's finances. At present, he is still working the land, but it is much more productive now than before. Over time, he learned how to have greater production from his fields. What he likes the most about his job is the close relationship he has with the earth, and he also enjoys watching his plantings grow. He has been doing this for 40 years and he considers the hardest thing to be taking care of his fields in inclement weather, since any oversight can affect the crop. Looking ahead, he hopes that the price of vegetables goes up, since his working capital will be affected if the opposite happens. This is the fiftth loan Alejandro has had with MFP. He is very happy to have obtained it, since he needed it urgently for his business. He is a well liked member of his communal bank, since he always brings order to the meetings. With the two thousand nuevos soles he has asked for, he will purchase more fertilizer for his plantings and he will also invest in purchasing cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will purchase fertilizer and some heads of cattle.

loans.name: Chocolate Group

texts.es:
El grupo chocolate está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas una de ellas es Cecilia del Carmen L., coordinadora del grupo la cual se dedica al comercio de artesanía la cual distribuye en los departamentos.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Luz Amanda Palacio propietaria de una mini pulpería, Ángela del Socorro O. vende palomitas y chicharrón de soya desde hace diez años  y Yeslina Auxiliadora V. vende picos desde hace cinco años. Ellas el crédito lo invertirán en sus negocios para mejorarlo.
texts.en:
The “Chocolate” group is made up of four hard-working, dedicated and determined women. One of whom is Cecilia del Carmen L., group coordinator, who sells handicrafts in various departments. Her fellow group members are Luz Amanda Palacio, grocery store owner, Ángela del Socorro O., who has sold popcorn and soy chicharrones (fried pork rinds) for 10 years, and Yeslina Auxiliadora V. who has sold picos (triangular pastry stuffed with cinnamon, sugar and cheese) for the last 5 years. They all need funds to invest in their businesses to improve them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una mujer trabajadora, tiene dos trabajos, en las horas de la mañana labora como conserje en una empresa privada, por la tarde atiende su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas para obtener mejores ingresos ya que es poco su salario. El cual comenzó con un poco de sus ahorros. Es madre soltera de cinco hijos, y uno de sus objetivos es mejorar su casa, el cual le hace falta hacer varias mejoras.

 Tiene comprado parte en materiales de construcción ya que desea hacer su cuarto de concreto para una mejor seguridad ante la delincuencia del barrio, así como mejorar su higiene, ya que es de zinc y aun de tierra. Comprara zinc, madera, clavos, arena, cemento para poder hacer este cambio que será de mucha sastifaccion en lo personal.
texts.en:
Martha is a hard-working woman who has two jobs. In the mornings she works as a janitor at a private company, and in the afternoons she runs her small business selling sweets to earn more income since her salary is low. She began this business with a little of her savings. She is a single mother of five children, and one of her goals is to improve her house, which needs several improvements. Martha has bought some construction materials since she wants to make her bedroom out of concrete for better security against neighborhood crime. She also wants to make the house cleaner, since it is made of zinc and even dirt. She will buy zinc, wood, nails, sand, and cement to be able to make this change. It will be of great personal satisfaction to her.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc, wood, nails, sand and cement to build concrete walls and improve security and hygiene

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 51 años de edad es casado, se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, pues posee su negocio propio de panaderia el que administra junto a su esposa, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de sus sobrinos que le ayudan a vender el pan en la ciudad.  

Esta solicitando su credito numero 11, y en este caso el segundo con kiva, con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, como por ejemplo: reparar el horno, los pilares y el techo, pues con las lluvias se mojaria y deterioraria mas, y no lograria que el pan sea cocido de manera correcta. 

Expresa que con el credito anterior logro consolidar su negocio pues pudo comprar materia prima a un mejor precio lo cual le genero mayores ganancias. 

El mayor sueño de don Francisco es poder tener su negocio bien establecido y con las mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Francisco, 51, is married and is known for being very hard-working. He owns a bakery that he and his wife run; his nephews help him sell the bread throughout the city. He is asking for his 11th loan, his 2nd with Kiva, to make improvements to his bakery. For example, repair the oven, columns and roof because with the rains they will get wet and become even more deteriorated and will prevent the bread from baking properly. He states that the previous loan made it possible for him to consolidate his business because he was able to buy raw materials at a better price which led to higher profits. Francisco’s dream is to have a bakery established with the best possible conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair roof, columns and oven.

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es:
El señor Roberto Jose S., es casado y con su esposa habita en el conocido  barrio capitalino Laureles Sur, tienen 2 hijos menores adolecentes  que estudian la secundaria y poseen muchas aspiraciones para realizar los estudios superiores, él trabaja como mecánico en un taller y chofer, en una empresa grande desde hace 9 años.

Ellos habitan en un peligroso barrio en donde los índices de delincuencia e inseguridad social, están a la orden del día, es por esta razón que el señor Roberto solicita un préstamo para la edificación de un muro  al frente de su casa esto con el objetivo de obtener una mayor seguridad a todos sus hijos y la tranquilidad como padres de poder ofrecerle a ellos un  lugar digno donde habitar. 
Ha sido gracias a Afodenic y los fondos Kiva que en otras ocaciones les han brindado prestamos para este mismo fin, es por esta razon que ellos se sienten argadecidos por la alabr social que han desempeñado en apoyo de los mas necesitaddos ya que el programa les ha permitido edificar su vivienda y realizar cambios a la infraestructura que le permiten una mejor estabilidad económico social a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Roberto José S. is married and lives with his wife and two teen-aged children, who are in secondary school and hope to be able to go to college, in the well-known Laureles Sur neighborhood of the capital. He has been a driver and mechanic for a large firm for the last 9 years. They live in a dangerous neighborhood where delinquency and social insecurity are the norm. Because of this, Roberto is asking for funds to build a wall in front of his house in order to have more security for his children and peace of mind as parents being able to provide proper housing for them. Thanks to Afodenic and Kiva, that have provided loans previously for the same ends, they are grateful for the social work they do to support those most in need because the program has made it possible for him to build his house and make improvements to its infrastructure that permit better economic and social stability for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in front of his house.

loans.name: Yoselina

texts.es:
Yoselina de 30 años de edad es casada, habita en la ciudad de Juigalpa junto a su familia comopuesta por su esposo el Sr. Jose Ruiz y sus 2 hijos Carlos de 10 años y Marilú de 7 años, ambos estudiando la primaria.  Yoselina es una pequeña comerciante de este municipio, tiene una pequeña pulperia donde vende productos para el consumo familiar y ademas tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende comida corriente.  

Esta solicitando su 5to credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, reparando las paredes de los cuartos, el piso y el techo que se encuentra en mal estado y quiere hacerlo antes que inicien las lluvias.  

El mayor sueño de Yoselina es poder tener una casa bonita en donde sus hijos puedan crecer con seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Yoselina, 30, is married. She lives in the city of Juigalpa with her family which includes her husband, José Ruiz, and her two children, Carlos, 10 and Marilú 7, both of whom are in primary school. Yoselina is a small business owner and has a small convenience store where she sells basic goods. She also has a small storefront where she sells a set menu. She is requesting this 5th loan in order to make home improvements, repairing the walls, floor and roof which are in poor shape and she would like to do so before the rainy season starts. Yoselina´s biggest dream is to have a nice house where her children can grow up in a safe and comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof, floor and walls of her house.

loans.name: Luisa Maria

texts.es: Luisa Maria tiene 38 años, su actividad es la elaboración y venta de artesanía y venta de leña, a pesar de que Luisa es una mujer muy escasos recursos ha encontrado la forma de mejorar su condición de vida.  Sus hijos viven con ella pues todavía están a su cargo, es una persona muy emprendedora. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, con la ayuda de su esposo han logrado mejorar la situación de gastos de su familia. El financiamiento que se solicita es para la compra de materia prima y leña ya que sus artículos son muy importantes para mejorar su hogar. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio y adquirir más activos.
texts.en:
Luisa María is 38 years old. Her activity is making and selling crafts and selling wood. In spite of being a women with few resources, Luisa has found a way to improve her standard of living. Her children live with her as they are still underage. She is a very enterprising person. For more thatn 3 years she has been working at this business and with the help of her husband has managed to improve the family´s financial situation. The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies and wood, which are important for improving her household. She hopes to expand her business and acquire more assets.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 35 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Gisela (35) y sus 5 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos.Trabajando arduamente Alejandro a logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos; todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus papas, choclos y zanahorias, los cuales posteriormente venderá en su ciudad, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, ya lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Para más adelante, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de alverja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende.Este es el quinto préstamo de Alejandro con MFP, y sabe que este préstamo le ayudara bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, y en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado.Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un caballo con el cual pueda transportar sus cultivos con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
35-year-old Alejandro is a very hard-working and happy father. He lives in his own home along with his wife, 35-year-old Gisele, and his five beloved children, who are the motivating force behind all his efforts. Through arduous work, Alejandro has succeeded in improving his crops. Every morning he rises very early to irrigate and tend his potatoes, corn and carrots, which he will later sell in the city; there he can get the best prices for his products. What he likes best about his job is that he can enjoy the freedom of working in his green fields. He has been doing this type of work for 16 years and thinks that the most difficult part of the job is to have to work the land for the entire day. This does not leave him with much time for other activities. In the future, he would like to have lands dedicated to sowing fields of peas, which are the best sellers these days. This is the fifth loan for Alejandro through partner organization MFP. He knows that this loan will help him significantly in developing his business. As such, he is prepared to make his loan payments punctually. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank and is therefore well respected. With the requested loan of $875, Alejandro will buy a horse to facilitate trasnportation of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a horse to transport crops.

loans.name: Yeni Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yeni de 29 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 niños, Rosita de 10 años y Alejandro de 3 añitos.  Yeni trabaja para el MINED de la Escuela San Patricio como maestra de primaria  desde hace 7 años.  

Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el proposito de mejorar su casa cambiando el techo de su cocina ya que el zinc y la madera se encuentran en mal estado.  

Tiene alto espiritu de superacion pues actualmente esta estudiando en la universidad el 1er año de Licenciatura en Pedagogia.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener una casa bonita con las condiciones basicas para que sus hijos vivan en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Yeni is 29 years old, single and has two children, Rosita, 10 and Alejandro 3, For the past 7 years, Yeni has worked for the MINED (Ministry of Education) at the San Patricio school as a grade school teacher. This 4th loan that she is requesting is to make improvements to her house and change the roof of the kitchen, as the zinc and wood is in poor condition. She has the drive to suceed and is currently studying her first year of a degree program in Education at the university. Her greatest dream is to be able to have a nice house so that her children can live in a comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of her kitchen

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La señora Rosalba esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual puso pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
Nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar en la escuela la inscripción ya que sus hijos no podrán terminar este siclo escolar.
Desea que sus hijos tengan el educación necesaria para salir a delante en su futuro y no tengan problemas de encontrar trabajo teniendo los estudios de una profesional.
Es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo en una fabrica en el área de producción.
texts.en:
Rosalba is grateful for your support of her previous loan, which she used to pay her children´s school expenses. Now she is asking for a loan to be able to pay the school tuition so that her children can finish the school year. She wants her children to have the education they need to get ahead in the future and that they do not have problems finding a job if they have a profession. She is a single mother and has three children to care for. She plans to repay the loan with earnings from her job at a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School expenses

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo prosperidad lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas una de ellas es María Concepción A., coordinadora del grupo quien desde tempranas horas empieza su jornada de trabajo con la molida del maíz para empezar a palmear las tortillas y el pones a coser en una olla los frijoles para que cuando sus clientes lleguen todo esté listo.

A. diario vende tortillas y frijoles en las mañanas y en las tardes mientras los fines de semana realiza nacatamales comida típica a base de maíz, cerdo, tomate, chiltoma, chile etc. 

Otra de las integrantes es Yolanda del Carmen R.  grupo propietaria de una minipulperia localizada en su casa de habitación  desde hace tres años donde invertirá el crédito en granos básicos y gaseosas. Mientras Luisa de los Ángeles García vende fresquito y boli desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
The Prosperidad (prosperity) group is made up of three hardworking and entreprenuerial women. One of them is María Concepción A., the coordinator of the group, who starts her working day very early in the morning, grinding corn for making tortillas by hand and cooking beans in a pot, so that when her customers arrive everything is ready. Every morning and afternoon A. sells tortillas and beans and on the weekends makes "nacatamales", a local dish made from corn, pork, tomatoes sweet peppers, chiles, etc. Another member of the group is Yolanda del Carmen R., the owner of a mini-convenience store located in her home for the past 3 years, in which she will invest her loan in basic staples and soft drinks. Meanwhile, Luisa de los Ángeles García for the past five years has been selling fresquito (a gelatin-based dessert) and boli (frozen fruit dessert, similar to a popsicle).

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma A., vive con su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos que son adultos y todos habitan en un barrio de la capital,  su pareja trabaja como gestor de compras y apoya con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, así mismo todos sus hijos se responsabilizan de gastos en los que se incurre mensualmente en el hogar.

Ella se dedica desde hace 33 años a la venta de ropa, empezando su negocio con préstamos, y apoyo económico de su pareja, la casa donde moran actualmente necesita de unas reparaciones que le permitan un mejor habita, sobre todo porque estamos en las temporadas de invierno y las aguas amenazan todos los días con la inseguridad, incomodidad para todos los miembros de la familia, es por esta razón que solicitan el préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo dicho proyecto. Ha sido gracias al apoyo de kiva que ha logrado la edificación de su hogar y agradece que se le ayude ha relizar la culminación a las reparaciones de su humilde morada, tras esto la satisfacción de los padres de familia de ofrecerle a sus hijos la posibilidad de un mejor porvenir a sus vidas.
texts.en:
Vilma A. lives with her life partner and their four adult children in one of the capital’s neighborhoods. Her partner works as a purchasing agent and contributes to household income; all the children also contribute to the household’s monthly expenses. For the last 33 years Vilma has sold clothes. She started her business with loans and financial help from her partner. The house they currently inhabit needs some repairs so that they may live a bit more comfortably especially because winter is here and every day the rains threaten their security and create discomfort for the whole family. For this reason she is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies for this project. It has been thanks to Kiva that she has managed to build her house and she is grateful for whatever help she can get now to make improvements to her humble abode because this provides her with much satisfaction as a parent for she knows that she is providing her children with the possibility of a better future for their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home repairs.

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: Ester tiene 40 años, ella es una mujer trabajadora que vive con sus 3 hijos y su madre, llamada Ema de 60 años, a quien atiende y la ayuda en su trabajo. Desde hace varios años se dedica en la Venta de emoliente (bebida elaborada con hierbas naturales) y de otras bebidas Calientes, que previamente son preparadas en su casa. Su punto de venta se encuentra a una hora y media de su vivienda, siendo las tardes en que empieza a vender estas bebidas calientes para esta temporada de invierno. De igual manera Ester vende productos de acuerdo a la temporada en que se encuentre, como comida y desayunos. Por otro lado tiene un moto carro el cual alquila, de esa manera no deja de recibir ingresos en estas diversas actividades que realiza. Ester se siente contenta con su trabajo y espera progresar, pues espera brindarle a su familia un futuro mejor. Este su tercer crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará maca, quinua, soya, quesos, huevos, harina y demás ingredientes para poder vender desayunos y emoliente, que en esta temporada de invierno la venta es muy buena.
texts.en:
Ester is 40 years old. She is a hardworking woman who lives with her 3 children and her mother, Ema, 60, whom she takes care of and who helps with her work. For several years, she has been selling emoliente ( a drink made from natural herbs) and other hot beverages that she prepares at home. Her point of sale is an hour and a half from her house. She starts selling these hot beverages in the afternoon during the wintertime. She also sells products according to the season, such as food and breakfasts. She also has a three-wheeled car thaht she rents out. This way she doesn't stop getting income from the different activities she does. She feels happy with her job and she hopes to progress and offer her family a better future. This is her third loan with MFP and she has always been punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy maca root, quinoa, soy, eggs, flour and other ingredients to sell breakfasts and emoliente, because at this time, in the winter, sales are very good.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare breakfasts and hot beverages.

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, B. Félicienne est mariée à HOUNGBEDJI Janvier et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Félicienne vit avec sa famille à Yenawa un quartier de la ville de cotonou depuis onze ans. Félicienne partage avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Félicienne n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Félicienne mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (cartons de tomate en boîte, de biscuits, sucre, savons, etc.) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est aussi à Dantokpa mais parfois au Nigéria, que Félicienne s'approvisionne. Félicienne exerce cette activité depuis sept ans environs et a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qu'elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Félicienne souhaite rehausser le niveau de son activité et satisfaire un peu plus sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Félicienne sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Félicienne B. is married to Janvier Houngbedji and is the mother of three children, all educated. Félicienne has lived with her family in Yenawa, a quarter in the city of Cotonou, for eleven years. Félicienne shares household responsibilities with her husband. She never went to school. To make ends meet, Félicienne sells diverse products (cartons of boxed tomatoes, biscuits, sugar, soap, etc.) in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Félicienne buys her supplies in Dantokpa and sometimes in Nigeria. She has done this work for about seven years and has already benefited from two loans which she has repaid in full. Faced with growing demand and a growing clientele, Félicienne wishes to take her business to the next level and better satisfy her clientele. For this reason, Félicienne is asking for a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of boxed tomatoes, sugar, soap, and biscuits.

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe lo integran tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Hazel del Rosario C. Jarquín coordinadora del grupo quien hace tres años inicio con el comercio de cosméticos de las líneas Zermat, Avon y las mas reciente Arabela en los cuales invertirá el crédito especialmente porque se ha cerca el día de las madres.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Ligia Vanessa O. Pérez  también comercializa cosméticos con lo que ha sacado adelante a su familia y Norma Amparo P. quien comercializa ropa interior en la zona franca.
texts.en:
The "Fe" (Faith) group is made up of three hard-working women. One of them is Hazel de Rosario C. Jarquín, the group coordinator. Three years ago, she began selling cosmetics for Avon, Zermat and most recently Arabela. She will invest her loan money in these lines because it is close to Mother's Day. The other group members are Ligia Vanessa O. Pérez, who also sells cosmetics and has helped her family move ahead this way, and Norma Amparo P., who sells lingerie in the free trade zone.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchases to fill orders

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, de 56 años, es una padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Julia  (57) y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Ignacio en su chacra, le han ayudado a mejorar la economía de su familia, ya que junto a su esposa son los encargados de velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, es por eso que trabaja todo lo que puede, sembrando papa, alverjas, habas, maíz y hortalizas, productos que posteriormente llevara a vender al mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos, ya que sabe que los productos sanos se venden a mejor precio, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros de un poblado de la sierra, que es donde tiene sus chacras. Para el futuro, espera mejorar sus cultivos  y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras.Este es el quinto préstamo de Ignacio con MFP y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea entrar en mora y perjudicar a su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido por el orden que pone en las reuniones.Con los mil trescientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará pesticidas y herbicidas, para cuidar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
56-year-old Ignacio is a humble and hard working father. He lives in his own home with 57-year-old wife Julia and their three youngest children, to whom they would like to offer a better quality of life. The arduous days that Ignacio has spent working his small farm have helped him to improve his family's financial state. Since he and his wife are solely responsible for their children's well being, Ignacio works as much as he can, sowing potatoes, peas, broad beans, corn and vegetables, which he will later take to sell in the biggest market in the city. What he likes best about his job is tending his crops, since he knows that a healthier product can be sold at a better price. He has been in this line of work for 12 years, and he finds the most difficult thing to be climbing the steep hills of the village in the mountains, where his small farm is located. In the future, he hopes to improve his crops and to sow all of his land. This is Ignacio's fifth loan though partner MFP, and he is ready to make all his loan repayments puctually. He does not want to be delinquent and jeapordize his communal bank, where he is well liked for organizing the meetings. With the loan proceeds, he will buy pesticides and herbicides for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and herbicides for crops.

loans.name: Las Leonas Group

texts.es:
Las Leonas así se denominan el grupo integrado por  Lea del Carmen Sánchez Castañeda,  Ana Marlene L. Solís y Vilma Leonor M. C. tres féminas trabajadoras y luchadoras quienes día a día se esfuerzan por mejorar y darle un mejor futuro a su familia.

La coordinadora del grupo es Lea del Carmen C. quien desde 2001 inicio con el comercio de sabanas y ropa de manera ambulante los cuales distribuye en Villa fontana y Ticomo. Ella con el préstamo invertirá en sabanas, toallas, colchas y pacas de ropa.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Ana Marlene L. Solís quien desde hace 30 años vende ropa y cosméticos y Vilma Leonor M. C. quien vende carne, pollo y ropa desde hace 12 años.
texts.en:
The group made up of Lea del Carmen Sánchez Castañeda, Ana Marlene L. Solís and Vilma Leonor M. C. is called “The Lionesses.” These three hard-working and tenacious women go out to work every day in an effort to improve and provide a better future for their families. The group coordinator is Lea del Carmen C. who has sold bed linen and clothing door-to-door since 2001 in Villa Fontana and Ticomo. She will use the requested funds to buy sheets, towels, bedspreads and bundles of clothing. Her fellow group members are Ana Marlene L. Solís who has sold clothes and cosmetics for the last 30 years and Vilma Leonor M. C. who has sold meat, chicken and clothes for the last 12 years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bed linens and bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Née en 1959 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. Elisabeth vit depuis trente trois ans environs à Yénawa, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elisabeth est mariée à KOUNOU Romain et est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Seulement un des enfants reste encore à la charge de Elisabeth et de son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Elisabeth n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis dix sept ans environs, Elisabeth vend des vêtements de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Elisabeth vend de l'huile à moteur à Gankpodo, un quartier de Cotonou. Elisabeth s'approvisionne au Nigéria et à Lomé au Togo, deux Etats voisins du Bénin. Elisabeth est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de cinq prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Elisabeth désire renforcer son activité et développer davantage son activité de vente d'huile à moteur ; raison pour laquelle Elisabeth sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1959 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin, Elisabeth A. has lived for about 33 years in Yenawa, a quarter in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Elisabeth is married to Romain Kounou and is the mother of four children, some of whom are educated. Only one of Elisabeth's children still lives with her and her husband. The couple shares different family responsibilities. Elisabeth did not go to school. For about 17 years, Elizabeth has sold clothing door-to-door. As a secondary means of earning a living, she sells motor oil in Gankpodo, a quarter in Cotonou. Elisabeth buys her supplies in Nigéria and in Lomé, Togo, two states close to Bénin. Elisabeth is an old ALIDé client, having already benefited from five loans, all of which she repaid in full. Elisabeth wishes to strengthen her business and develop her motor oil business. This is why she is asking for another loan.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothing and of cans of motor oil.

loans.name: Marisela Group

texts.es:
El grupo Marisela está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzada y decididas una de ellas es Karla Yessenia E. R. quien desde hace cinco años vende ropa ambulante y helados y chocobananos en su casa. Ella con el crédito comprara pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas…etc.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Santos Yadira Gutiérrez Flores quien vende cosméticos y  ropa y Maricela E.  la cual vende verduras desde hace 8 años. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios para salir a delante.
texts.en:
The Marisela group is made up of three hard-working, dedicated and tenacious women. One of them is Karla Yessenia E. R. who has been and itinerant clothing merchant for the last five years; she also sells frozen treats and chocolate covered bananas from home. She will use the funds to buy pants, shirts, skirts, bluses, etc. Her fellow group members are Santos Yadira Gutiérrez Flores who sells clothes and cosmetics and Maricela E. who has been a vegetable merchant for 8 years. They will invest the funds in their various businesses in order to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Calavi, K. Marcelle est mariée à LANKPOKINTO Oumbabè, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Marcelle s'est installée avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Agongbomey à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin), depuis près de quinze ans. Marcelle vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Marcelle vend depuis environs vingt ans, des détergeants (savons, dentifrices, etc.) à la devanture de sa maison. Marcelle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Marcelle a déjà obtenu trois crédits de ALIDé, qu'elle a bien remboursés. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'accroître sa clientèle et par ricochet son revenu, Marcelle sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Calavi, Marcelle K. is married to Oumbabè LANKPOKINTO and is the mother of three school-attending children. For 15 years, she's been living with her husband and children in the Agongbomey neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Marcelle helps her husband with the various expenses of the family. To provide for herself, Marcelle has been selling detergents, soaps, toothpaste, etc in front of her house for approximately 20 years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. She already benefited from three loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, that were all repaid without problems. With the goal of bolstering her working capital and increasing her clientele and, as a result, her income, Marcelle is seeking another loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soaps and toothpaste

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 64 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo José de 67 años, tiene dos hijas, quienes ya tienen familia y son independientes. Hace mas de 5 años se dedica al alquiler y administración de su auto, quien en un inicio su esposo trabajaba en una compañía de taxis, y la necesidad de Rosa es de participar en este negocio. Así que su esposo con algunos ahorros pudieron comprar un auto, desde entonces ella se dedica de la administración, en principio dejó a cargo de dos chóferes, turnándolo de día y de noche, el único inconveniente fue que con el tiempo y el mal uso que le dieron a su vehiculo, resulto malográndose. Ahora solo trabaja con gente que cuidan del vehiculo como si fueran de su propiedad, además que son puntuales y honrados en el pago del trabajo que realizan diariamente. En un futuro quisiera comprar más autos y así tener una pequeña empresa. Este su tercer crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, espera refaccionar su vehiculo para así dejarlo óptimo y que le pueda generar mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 64 years old. She lives with her 67 year old husband, José. They have two daughters who are independent and have their own families. For over five years she has been renting and managing her automobile. At the start her husband worked for a taxi company, and Rosa needed to participate in this business. Her husband was able to buy an automobile with some savings. From then on she devoted herself to the administration of the business. At the beginning she left the care of the automobile to two drivers. They took turns; one worked by day and the other at night. The only drawback was that in time their misuse caused a break down. Now she only works with people who take care of the vehicle as if it were their own property. They also need to be punctual and honest with the payment for their daily work. In the future she would like to buy more automobiles and have a small company. This is her third loan with MFP. She has always been known to be timely in making all of her payments. She plans on using the requested loan to refurbish her vehicle. This will leave it in optimum condition so that she will be able to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance on her vehicle

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 51 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Juana (45)  y sus 4 menores hijos, a los que desea brindar una mejor educación.Los campos de cultivo han sido en la vida de Juan, una actividad necesaria para sobrevivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propias tierras, donde tiene sembrados papas, alverjas y ollucos, los cuales una vez cosechados, llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad de su familia, ya lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos son  los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. Para más adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorar sus cultivos.Este es el cuarto préstamo de Juan con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado.Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de alverja, abono e insecticidas, para tener buenos cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan, age 51, is a very hard-working and responsible father. He lives in his own house with his 45 year old wife, Juana, and their four minor children. He wants to give his children a better education. The fields with Juan’s crops have always been a necessary activity in his life in order to survive. Since he was very small his parents always taught him how to work on the farm. That is why he decided to continue with this familial work. Now he has his own land where he has planted potatoes, peas, and “ollucos” (a root vegetable). He will take them to the market in the city when they are harvested. What he likes most about his work is planting. He knows that the family’s peace of mind is dependent upon this activity. He has been doing this activity for 40 years. He thinks that the most difficult part in taking care of the crops is the abrupt changes in weather. This greatly affects his productivity. Later, he wishes to keep working hard and improve his crops. This is Juan’s fourth loan with MFP. He knows that the money from the loan will be very beneficial in developing this activity. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank. Therefore, he is very respected. He will use the 3,000 PEN he has requested to buy pea seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to have good crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es:
María de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín( llamado así por sus montañas y caminos de tierra) de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 20 y 18 años, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, vende platos típicos del Ecuador, empezó con el negocio cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y no tenían dinero para mantener su hogar. Ellos gastaron sus ahorros en sillas y mesas para el pequeño restaurante, e invitaron a sus amigos para que prueben la comida en su casa porque no tenian loca.  

Poco a poco fue incrementando las personas y debido a la gran demanda de la comida continuaron con el negocio, ahora trabajan todos los días desde las 07h00am hasta las 00h00pm, su esposo y sus hijos le ayudan a servir mientras que ella hace la comida, con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas y construir mejor su casa para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

En el futuro quiere tener su propio local para el restaurante.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old, and lives in El Fortín (‘the Fort’, which is named after its mountains and dirt roads) on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has two children, ages 20 and 18. María has a small restaurant in her home, where she sells typical Ecuadoran dishes. She started her business when her husband lost his job and they did not have money to support the household. They used their savings to purchase tables and chairs for the small restaurant, and invited their friends to try the food at their home, since they did not have a separate location. Little by little they have increased their number of customers, and they have stayed in business because of the great demand for their food. They now work every day from 7:00 AM until midnight. María’s husband and children help serve while she prepares the food. She wants to use this loan to purchase tables and to improve the construction of their home in order to provide better service for their customers. In the future María wants to have her own premises for the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing tables and making improvements to the premises

loans.name: Joelle

texts.fr: A. Joelle est née le 23 Novembre 1972 à Lomé au Togo. Mariée à JOHNSON Aurelien, Joelle est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a environs trois ans que la famille s'est installée au quartier Agongbomè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Joelle vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Joelle est allée à l'école et a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Depuis près de sept ans, Joelle mène comme activité, la vente de tissus et des chaussures, par le système de distribution. Joelle achète ses produits à Lomé au Togo, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Joelle a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'agrandir son commerce et d'accroître sa clientèle, Joelle sollicite un troisième crédit. Joelle ambitionne ouvrir plus tard une boutique pour vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Joelle A. was born on November 23, 1972, in Lomé, Togo. She's married to Aurelien JOHNSON and the mother of three school-attending children. Approximately three years ago, the family moved in to the Agongbomé neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Joelle helps her husband by supporting the various family expenses with him. Joelle attended school but dropped of during middle school. For approximately seven years, Joelle has been selling fabrics and shoes through the distribution system. She buys her supplies in Lomé, Togo, and also in Dantokpa, an international market place in Benin. Joelle already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, that were repaid without problems. With the goal of expanding her business and increasing her clientele, she's seeking a third loan. Joelle ambitions to open her own store later on to sell her products.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and shoes

loans.name: Grupo Hatarinas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Hatarinas” se encuentra ubicada en la zona de El Agustino, departamento de Lima, está conformado por 10 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 1 año. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades de producción, comercio y servicio.
María del Carmen quien a su vez asume el cargo de presidenta, tiene 44 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos en edad académica, se dedica a la venta de café en granos y servicio de internet desde hace 1 año, se inicio ya que como ella vendía productos de belleza y tenia clientes decidió vender café en invierno y tuvo una buena acogida, así que decidió continuar en esta actividad, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria María del Carmen ha comprado artefactos para su vivienda y esencialmente ha apoyado en la educación de sus hijos, ya que desea que sean profesionales. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en el título profesional de su hija.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad. (niños en la foto, hijos de los socios)
texts.en:
The Hatarinas Communal Bank is located in the El Agustino area in the Lima department. It is comprised of ten members. They have been working with Edapropa-Prosperidad for one year. The members do diverse activities in production, commerce and service. María del Carmen is the president. She is 44, married, and has three school age children. She has been selling coffee beans and providing internet service for one year. She started because she sold beauty products, and she had customers. She decided to sell coffee in the winter, and it was well received. So, she decided to continue this activity. With the effort of her daily work, María del Carmen has bought appliances for her home. She has essentially helped with her children’s education because she wants them to become professionals. She will use the loan for her daughter’s professional certificate. All of our members are grateful for the support, and they are committed to making their payments according to Prosperidad’s timeline. (The children in the photo are the members’ children.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her daughter’s professional certificate

loans.name: Hortense

texts.fr: Née en 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, L. Hortense est mariée à YONLI Moussa et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Hortense vit depuis sept ans au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. Hortense vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges de la famille. Hortense n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales et satisfaire ses besoins, Hortense vend des bois de chauffage à son domicile. Hortense s'approvisionne à Pahou au Bénin. Hortense mène cette activité depuis six ans et a déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts qu'elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle, Hortense  désire renforcer davantage son activité et se faire plus de revenu pour mieux assurer les besoins de ses enfants. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Hortense L. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in 1979. She's married to Moussa YONLI and the mother of two school-attending children. For seven years, she's been living with her husband and children in the Gankpodo neighborhood in Cotonou. Hortense helps her husband and provides for the family expenses with him. She never attended school. To contribute to the family expenses and provide for herself, Hortense sells firewood at her house. She gets her supplies in Pahou, Benin. She's been running this business for six years, and already benefited from four loans that were repaid without problems to Kiva's partner, ALIDé. To meet customer demand, she would like to bolster her business and increase her income to better provide for her children. This is the reason why she's seeking another loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood wholesale

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Née en 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Justine est mariée à AKODE Benoît. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, depuis environs six ans. Justine  assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Justine n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Justine vend depuis environs sept ans, de l'huile de palme à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Justine s'approvisionne également à Dantokpa. Justine a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts de ALIDé, prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Justine désire renforcer davantage son activité et augmenter sa part de marché, ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenu. C'est dans cette optique que Justine sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Justine K. was born in 1974 at Cotonou, the business capital in Benin. She is married to Benoit Akode. The couple have two children who have attended school. The family has lived in the Agbodiedo neighborhood of Cotonou for the past 6 years. Justine and her husband, together, share meeting the family's living expenses and responsibilities. Justine has never attended school. To insure that their needs are met, Justine has engaged in selling palm oil at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, for the past 7 years. She also buys her supplies at the Dantopa market. Justine has already made two loans with ALIDe, loans that have been duly repaid. She would like to strengthen her business advantage and increase her market share, which would enable her to generate greater revenues. For this reason, she would like to make this third loan.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers of palm oil for resale

loans.name: Clémentine

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, Z. Clémentine est mariée à KOUTON Marcelin. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. Il y a près de sept ans que la famille s'est installée à Agbodjèdo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Clémentine assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Clémentine n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs douze ans que Clémentine mène comme activité, la vente de farine de manioc et de sodabi (boisson alcoolisée locale). Cette activité lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux différents besoins de sa famille. Clémentine vend ses produits à son domicile, et s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Clémentine a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qu'elle avait bien remboursés. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Clémentine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Clémentine Z. was born in 1971 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, and is married to Marcelin KOUTON. The couple has one child, who doesn't go to school yet. Approximately seven years ago, the family moved in to Agbodjèdo, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Clementine provides for the family together with her husband. She never attended school. For approximately 12 years, Clémentine has been selling cassava flour and sodabi (a local alcoholic beverage). With the income drawn from this business, she provides for the family. She sells her products at her home, and gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. Clémentine already benefited from two loans, that she repaid without problems. In order to increase her working capital and bolster her business, she's seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Maria Silvería

texts.es:
La solicitante es la Sra. María Silveira B. la misma es casada posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias D. un hogar es  comerciante es propietaria D. una despensa y ventas D. comidas y bebidas heladas en el Barrio San Miguel cuenta con 2 años D. experiencia en el manejo D. ventas D. articulos D. primera necesidad. 
Esta actividad le permite contar ayudar a su familia especialmente para la alimentación. 
Ella esta muy satisfescha y muy conforme con la actividad que realiza ya que cuenta buena clientela e ingresos. 
Solicita el préstamos para la compra D. articulos D. primera necesidad como bebidas,azúcar, harina, arroz, fideos y aticulos D. limpieza.
texts.en:
The loan applicant is María Silveira B. who is married and has her own house that has all the basic comforts. She is a merchant and has a grocery store in the San Miguel neighborhood. She has two years experience running a basic items sales business. The business helps her proviD. for her family, especially their nutritional needs. She is very satisfied and content with her work because she has a good customer base and good income. She is asking for funds to buy basic needs items like: beverages, sugar, flour, pasta and cleaning supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Believe In God Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Believe In God II” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profits and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Abdul T. who is pictured on the left. He is age 35 and was born in Port Loko, northern Sierra Leone. He is married with three children, two of whom are attending primary school and the other is still suckling.

For many years now, Abdul has been selling provisions (milk, sugar, drinks, butter, cocoa, etc.) in his little shop. With his SLL 500,000 share of the group loan, Abdul will expand his business by buying more milk, sugar, cocoa, butter, drinks, etc., wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more milk, sugar, cocoa, butter, drinks, etc., for his store

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Believe In God” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-business women who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Umu S., pictured on the left. She was born in Makeni about 45 years ago. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a teacher and three of her children are attending primary schools.

Umu sells mints, sugar, chewing gum, butter, bread, etc., in a small shop; she has been in this business for four years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy more mints, sugar, chewing gum, butter and bread wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more mints, sugar, chewing gum, butter and bread wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
Shown in the photo are the members of the “Self Help” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Ya Marie K. pictured on the left. She is age 45 and was born in Makeni where she lives with her husband and five children. Her husband is a professional worker and her children are attending primary and secondary schools.

For many years now, Ya Marie has sold charcoal, toothpaste, bathing soap, etc. With her share of the loan, she will invest in her business by buying wholesale more of the above mentioned items.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, toothpaste, bathing soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mayanka Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Mayanka” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 2,400,000. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Mariatu K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. The approximately 50-year-old woman is married to a businessman and they have three children.

Mariatu has been a businesswoman for more than thirty-five years now. She sells market-foods such as groundnuts (peanuts), palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy wholesale more of the above mentioned items to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more ground-nuts, palm-oil, rice, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Peace & Unity Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesspeople in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will be able to add more stock to their business, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by feeding and clothing their children and sending them to school. 

Alusine T.Z. K. is the leader of this group. He was born in Makeni 35 years ago and is single with two children. He sells radios, tape recorders, watches, phone accessories, belts, etc., and has been doing this business for ten years now. With his share of the loan, he will expand his business by buying more radios, tape recorders belts and mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy more radios, tape recorders, belts and mobile phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Tamemsuba Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the “Tamemsuba” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve; they will be able to at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills if any of them fall sick.

Fatmata C. is the leader of this group. She was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. She is 45 years of age, married to a teacher, and they have four children – one in primary school and three in secondary school.

Fatmata sells firewood and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and has been doing this business for ten years now. With the help of this loan, she will buy more firewood and palm-oil in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and palm-oil in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Marie's Group

texts.en:
These are members of “Marie’s Group”, small-scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses and make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve; they will be able to at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills if any of them fall sick.

Marie C. is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni. She is 35 years of age, married to an architect, and they have four children – two in primary school, one in secondary school and one not of school-going age.

Marie C. sells market-food – rice, pepper, Maggi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), onions, oil, etc. With the help of this loan, she will buy more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, pepper, Maggi, onions, oil, etc., to sell

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of “God Is Great” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profits and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Isha B. who is on the left in the photo. She is approximately age 26 and was born in Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have no children.

For five years now, Isha has been selling ready-to-wear clothes such as jeans for both men and women. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying more ready-to-wear clothes wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more ready-to-wear clothes wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Taborsu Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Abdul K. who is pictured in the middle. Abdul is age 39. He was born in Makeni where he lives with his wife and three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools except for the last who is not of school-going age. For 15 years now, Abdul has been selling honey, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), beans, onions, pepper, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. He will invest his share of this loan in his business and buy the above items wholesale. 

In the photo are members of the “Taborsu” Group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Makeni city, in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy honey, palm oil, beans, onions, pepper, Maggi, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To equip his workshop and buy spare parts

loans.name: Heiddy Del Socorro

texts.es: Heiddy Del Socorro tienen 33 años, su actividad es la venta de productos de limpieza. Ella tiene más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio es su primer crédito y está muy entusiasmada con este negocio, pues es su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia, pues es una mujer muy emprendedora y se siente muy satisfecha con sus avances. Por lo que este financiamiento lo solicita para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su actividad. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio lo suficiente  para mejorar su condición.
texts.en:
Heiddy Del Socorro, 33, sells cleaning supplies. She has been in this line of work for 2 years and this is her first loan. She is very enthusiastic about the business because it’s her family’s main source of income; she is a very enterprising woman and she’s very satisfied with her progress to date. She is asking for funding to buy raw materials. Her wish is to expand her business enough to improve her condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock up on corn and "gari" (cassava flour)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Micaela Bastidas Ii Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Micaela Bastidas II”, está conformada por 10 socias quienes se desempeñan en labores de comercio minorista e informal, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace 2 años.
María Elena, mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta, desde hace 8 meses,  tiene 39 años,  es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 17 años que actualmente se está preparando para postular a la Universidad.
Desde hace 15 años María Elena se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir (Alta Costura), se inicio porque estudio alta costura y sastrería. Con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado poner un taller con tres maquinas (recta, remalladora y recubridora), su gran sueño es implementar mas su negocio y exportar sus productos.
El reciente préstamo, María lo destinará en la compra de mercadería (tela, hilos, cierres, etc.). Agradecen el financiamiento para sus actividades comerciales y seguirán cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
The community outreach program, Micaela Bastidas II, has 10 members who operate small, informal businesses. They have worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 2 years. Maria Elena, an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial woman, has been the president of the group for 8 months. She is 39 years old and a single mother with a 17 year old son who is preparing to study at the university. For 15 years, Maria Elena has operated a tailoring business (Alta Costura) that she started after studying dress-making and tailoring. Working hard every day, she has managed to set up a workshop with three sewing machines (chainstitch, lockstitch, coverstitch). She wants to expand the business and export her products. Maria will use her most recent loan to buy supplies (cloth, thread, buttons, etc.). The loan will add to her working capital so that she can continue operating the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, a sus 38 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos, de 10, 19 y 23  años, trabaja con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 6 años, se dedica  al alquiler de cuartos en su vivienda, desde hace 3 años, se inicio en este negocio a raíz de que alquilaba mesas de billar y vio la necesidad que algunas personas tenían para obtener un lugar de vivienda, además trabaja en el mercado preparando milanesas, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha construido su casa.
El gran sueño de Luz, es tener un minimarket. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la construcción del 2do piso de su vivienda. Luz se encuentra muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz is a hard-working, entrepreneurial woman. She is 38 years old and married with 3 children who are 10, 19, and 23 years old. She has worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 6 years. She rents rooms in her house, a business that she has operated for 3 years. She started renting rooms when she owned a business renting pool tables and saw that some people needed a place to live. Luz also works at a local market making milanesas (a local dish made from breading and frying meat). Her hard work built the house that she owns. Her dream is to own a minimarket. She will use the most recent loan to add a second floor to her house. Luz is very grateful for the support that she has received because it has helped her to the improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add extra floor

loans.name: Albertha

texts.es:
Alberta es una mujer que lucha día a día por salir adelante, a sus 48 años es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, trabaja con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 11 años, se dedica  al reciclaje de cartón, botellas, fierros, cobre, desde hace 10 años, además realiza trabajos de limpieza en una universidad, se inicio en este negocio por la necesidad que había en su hogar, ya que su esposo se quedo sin empleo y no tenían ningún ingreso, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado la construcción de su vivienda y la educación de sus hijos.
El gran sueño de Alberta, es comprar un local para utilizarlo como depósito para su mercadería. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de una balanza para pesar la mercadería que recicla. Alberta se encuentra muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alberta is a woman who strives, day after day, to pull herself up. She is 48 years old and partnered with 3 grown children. She has worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 11 years. She has operated a business recycling paper, bottles, metal, copper, etc. for 10 years. She also works as a cleaner at the university. She started working because she needed to pay the family's bills when her husband was out of work. Her efforts have paid off and she has managed to build a house and educate her children. Alberta's dream is to buy a space where she can keep her stocks. She will use the most recent loan to buy a scale for weighing the products that she recycles. Alberta is very grateful for the support she's been given because it has helped her to improve her quality of life and her children's.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a scale for recycling business

loans.name: Elva Mercedes

texts.es:
Elva de 59 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos de 18, 17 y 15 años, ella es vendedora de mejillones (son moluscos que viven formando comunidades más o menos numerosas, fijados a las rocas en la costa del Ecuador. Se sirven en varios platos típicos) y otros mariscos, los vende en el mercado de “San Vicente” del suburbio. 

Con esfuerzo y dedicación Elva tiene un puesto en el mercado y vende los mejillones a $ 1.50 la funda, conchas a $ 3.00 la funda etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 12h00 todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mejillones, conchas y pescado para vender en su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local para su negocio de mariscos.
texts.en:
Elva, 59, lives in El Suburbio, Guayaquil; she has three children who are 18, 17 and 15 years of age. She sells mussels (mollusks living in more or less numerous colonies attached to rocks along Ecuador’s coast, they are served in a variety of typical dishes) and other seafood in El Suburbio’s “San Vicente” market. Elva invests effort and dedication into her stall in the market. She sells mussels for $1.50 a bag, conchs for $3.00 a bag, etc. She’s open for business from 8-12 daily. She will use the funds to buy mussels, conchs and seafood to sell in her stall. She’d love to have a fish market in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shellfish.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald, de 29 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rina (25) y su querida hija Abigail ( 3), quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.El trabajo al que se dedica, es el cultivo de papas, maíz, alverjas y habas. Todos los días, desde muy temprano, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Él vende sus productos en el mercado de su ciudad, pues  es donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos maltraten las plantaciones. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos, para tener mejores ingresos.Es  el quinto préstamo de Ronald con MFP, y manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con todos.Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en insecticidas, ya que desea tener campos libres de plagas, y de esta manera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Ronald, 29, is a hard-working man and a loving father. He lives in a house he owns with his wife, Rina, 25, and his much-loved daughter, Abigail, 3. Rina and Abigail are the reasons that Ronald works so hard to get ahead. He operates a business cultivating potatoes, maize, peas and broad beans. Every day, starting very early, he works in his fields because he knows that the money that he will get for his crop depends very much on its quality. He sells his crop in the city market because that is where he can get the most for it. What he most likes about his job is harvesting his fields because that is when he feels that his hard work has paid off.
