Agripina is a member of the Violeta (Violet) Community Bank, and she needs a loan for 2000 soles, which she will invest to buy blouses and pants. Agripina dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses and pants

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es casada y tiene 5 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Maximiliana se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, con la ayuda de peones, sus ventas los realiza a los distribuidores en el mismo lugar.
Maximiliana integra el Banco Comunal Violeta y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que sera invertido para la compra de leña.
El sueño de Maximiliana son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is married and has 5 children. She lives in the community of Huayllapampa, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Maximiliana makes artisanal bricks, with the help of workers. She sells her products to distributors in the same place. Maximiliana is a member of the Violeta (Violet) Community bank, and she needs a loan for 1000 soles, which she will invest to buy firewood. Her dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Sonia Graciela

texts.es:
Sonia de 28 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene una hija de 5 años, su esposo es conductor, ella tiene una pequeña peluquería empezó el negocio haciendo peinados a sus vecinos y amigas para solventar sus gastos.

Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de trabaja, y por su esfuerzo y dedicación pudo construir mejor su casa y poner la peluquería en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h30pm todos los días, hace cortes de cabellos, tinturado, alisados con creatina etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar tintes, shampoo y cosméticos para su negocio.  

En el futuro quiere expandir mas su negocio, y tener mas peluquerías.
texts.en:
Sonia is 28 years old and lives in the suburban area of Guayaquil. She has a five-year-old daughter, and her husband is a driver. She has a small hair salon, which she started by offering haircuts to her neighbors and friends to fund her expenses. Little by little she increased her capital, and, because of her strength and dedication, she was able to improve her house and move her hair salon to the front of her house. She works from 8 in the morning until 7:30 in the evening every day. She does haircuts for men, hair dyeing, chemical straightening, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy dyes, shampoo and cosmetics for her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business more and have more hair salons.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dyes and shampoo

loans.name: Nancy Helida

texts.es:
Nancy es casada, tiene 2 hijos, Nancy tiene una tienda en un local céntrico en donD. venD. variedad D. productos como abarrotes en general, útiles D. escritorio, brinda servicio D. fotocopiado, y tiene cabina telefónica, su negocio esta ubicado al frente D. una escueL., actividad que realiza todos los días.
Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal Violeta y necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles con el cual comprara gaseosas, azúcar, papeles.
Nancy sueña con educar a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is married and has two children. She has a store in a central location. She sells a variety of products like general groceries and desk supplies. She also offers photocopy services, and she has a telephone booth. Her business is located in front of a school. She does this work everyday. Nancy belongs to the Violeta Communal Bank. She needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy soft drinks, sugar, and papers. Nancy dreams of educating her children and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sugar, and papers

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena, tiene la edad de 34 años es casada y su esposo labora como guarda de seguridad,  tienen 4 hijos menores de edad que estudian la escuela secundaria y primaria, habitan en el barrio Laureles Norte, ella tiene su propio negocio el cual es una pulpería.

Fue con el apoyo de su esposo que logro tener su propio negocio,  dentro de las dificultades que más la han preocupado ha sido las altos y bajos de los precios que no permiten una estabilidad económica, ella tiene la esperanza que en los meses venideros la situación mejore y permita la recuperación del capital en el que se ha incurrido tras esta inestabilidad, ella ahora solita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos con el fin de surtir un poco mas su negocio y ofertarlo entre su clientela, espera que las ventas le aumenten tras esta inversión y le permita el capital necesario para futuros proyectos que favorezcan a la economía de la familia. en el pasado tambien con el apoyo de afodenic y Kiva a podido emprender su negocio y tras esto mejorado su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María Elena is 34 years old and married. Her husband works as a security guard. They have three minor children who go to elementary school and high school. They live in the Laurels Norte neighborhood. She has her own business, a mini-market. It was with help from her husband that she was able to have her own business. One of the difficulties that has concerned her the most has been the highs and lows in the prices. They do not allow for economic security. She has the hope that in the coming months the situation will improve. She hopes it will allow for the recuperation of the incurred expenses due to this instability. She is now requesting a loan to buy a greater inventory of products in order to stock her store more and have more to offer her customers. She hopes to increase sales with this investment. It will allow her to have the necessary capital for future projects, which will help her family. In the past she was able to establish her business with help from Afodenic and Kiva. This improved her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater inventory of products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Violeta.
Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de artesanías en telar, productos que elabora y comercializa a intermediarios, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas.
El sueño de Elizabeth es mejorar su negocio y educar a su hijos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the Violeta village bank. She lives with her partner and has one child. She works every day making hand-woven products that she sells to middlemen. Elizabeth is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of wool. Her dream is to improve her business and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy V. A., tiene la edad de 28 años, está en unión libre, y vive con su esposa. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Roy también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Roy V. A. is 28 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his wife. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer for his coffee crop. He hopes to give his coffee crop the adequate maintenance so that he can obtain the best quality and be able to obtain the most profits possible at harvest. This is the first time he has obtained a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the facilities they have provided him. Roy has also been farming for many years. He hopes in the future to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Inez Alfonso

texts.es: Inez Alfonso de 54 años, vive en  el municipio del Jicaral, su esposa es ama de casa, por la falta de oportunidades y la necesidad de tener un medio de ingreso necesario en su familia, pues tienen 7 hijos pero solamente 1 depende de ellos. Ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a brindar clases pero su salario no era suficiente, El tiene más de 10 años de mantener este negocio. Para incrementar su pulpería quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, aceite y bebidas. Su deseo es mantener activo este negocio que es la única manera de mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Inez Alfonso, 54 years old, lives in the town of Jicaral. His wife is a homemaker because of a lack of opportunities, despite the need to have a source of income necessary in the family, since they have 7 children although only 1 still depends on them. Inez had been teaching classes but since his salary was not sufficient is now concentrating on he running the grocery store business which he has had for over 10 years. To expand the business he wants to use this loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, and drinks. His wish is to keep this business active since it is the only way he has to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Urla

texts.es: Urla, de 39 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora,  vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.Se dedica a la producción de  bisutería con alambres, cristales y perlas. Es diestra en el tejido de dijes y aretes, y cada modelo  es muy peculiar, además ofrece sus creaciones sobre una franela para que sus clientes escojan con facilidad la bisutería de su agrado. Cuando sus hijos eran pequeños estropeaban su avance y hoy en día; son sus fieles colaboradores, con la ayuda de ellos  entrega oportunamente sus pedidos. Está muy contenta por lo que produce, ya que lo realiza en su casa, donde también  vende desayunos. Así lleva 8 años trabajando; sólo que siente dificultad al no contar con herramientas apropiadas, que le  faciliten el avance. En el futuro, lo que más desea es instalar  su taller de bisutería.Este es su doceavo  préstamo con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, es por eso que  se compromete en pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente.Urla tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de una máquina que prense alambres, para  de ese modo, avanzar más rápido en la entrega de sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Urla is 39 years old. She is a mother and very hardworking. She lives with her husband and her 4 children in their own house. She makes jewelry with wire, crystals, and beads. She is skilled in making pendants and earrings and each model is unique. She offers her creations for sale on a piece of flannel so that her customers can easily choose the jewelry they like. When her children were small, they sometimes made it difficult to work; they are now her loyal collaborators and with their help, she can finish orders on time. She is very happy with what she makes because she can do this at home, where she also sells breakfasts. She has been working in this business for 8 years. One of her difficulties is not having appropriate tools that would make it easier to work. Her greatest wish for the future is to have a jewelry workshop. This is her twelfth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She knows the loan will be very beneficial for increasing her working capital, and so she promises to make all of her payments on time. Urla plans to use the requested money to buy a machine that makes wire so that she can work more quickly on her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine that will make wire for her jewelry

loans.name: Lázaro Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Lázaro Jesús H.  es casado y con 6 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son menores de edad y los otros cuatro adolecentes, ellos habitan en Sabana Grande, un barrio capitalino conocido por su alto índice de delincuencia, que amenazantes de la población que allí mora, estos datos son tomados según la Policía Nacional de Nicaragua, así mismo sus habitantes son personas de escasos recursos entre los cuales son de familias grandes, sin empleos o fuentes de ingresos que no les permite mejorar sus niveles económico-sociales.

El señor Lázaro se ha dedicado toda su vida a la carpintería, empezando como aprendiz a muy temprana edad y el buen ahorro le permitió abrir su propio taller de ebanistería, comenzando sus trabajos en la reparación de muebles, ahora su demanda ha crecido, gracias a su buen prestigio que le permite nuevos clientes y nuevas solicitudes de trabajo que aportan en gran medida a su economía, con el negocio en pie solicita un préstamo para la inversión destinando a realizar reparaciones al techo de su casa, debido a que está bien deteriorado y amenaza con la seguridad de sus hijos y la de su esposa, esta inversión les permitirá mejores comodidades que favorecerá al bienestar de todos.
texts.en:
Lázaro Jesús is married and has six children, four of whom are adolescents and the others are younger. They live in Sabana Grande, a neighborhood in the capital, known for its high crime rate, according to the Nicaraguan National Police statistics. Its residents are people of limited resource; mostly large families with no employment or sources of income that would allow them to improve their economic status. Lázaro has been a carpenter all of his life, having started as an apprentice when he was very young. He was able to save enough money to start his own carpentry shop, beginning with furniture repair. His services are now very much in demand, thanks to his good reputation. He gets new customers and job orders, which help boost his income. He is asking for this loan in order to be able to make repairs his roof, which is now in very bad state and it threatens the security of his children. This will allow him to better provide for their well being.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Katherin Rosmeri

texts.es: Katherin tiene 22 años  de edad es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, vive en la casa de su madre, casa  cercada de madera. Ella se dedica  a la venta de pollo en el mercado la union en puesto de su madre. Ella se dedica  a este negocio hace 5 años , se inicio desde muy joven apoyando a su madre en el mismo rubro de negocio, ella es un persona muy joven el cual tine muchos sueños y objetivos, uno de ellos es poder tener su negocio mucho mas grande. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en surtir su mercaderia con la venta de huevos.
texts.en:
Katherin, 22, is a single mother with one son 5 years old. She lives in her mother's home, a home surrounded by woods. She sells chicken in the La Union market in her mother's place. She has done this business for 5 years, having begun helping her mother in the same type of business when she was very young. She is a very young person who has many dreams and goals, one of which is to have her business be much larger. With the money she has requested, she will enlarge her offerings with egg sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales merchandise

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es: Jimmy B. R., tiene la edad de 27 años, está en unión libre, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El tiene 4 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es  la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Jimmy también trabaja desde hace varios años con el ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Jimmy B. R., 27 years old, is in a common-law marriage and has 4-year-old son who is is first priority. Jimmy is requesting this loan to purchase livestock; the idea is to have double-purpose cattle (milk and meat). He hopes to properly maintain the cattle in order to obtain the greatest possible income when he sells them. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the opportunities they offer. Jimmy has worked with livestock for several years. He hopes in the future to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and a businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una mujer trabajadora, tiene dos trabajos, en las horas de la mañana labora como conserje en una empresa privada, por la tarde atiende su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas para obtener mejores ingresos ya que es poco su salario. El cual comenzó con un poco de sus ahorros. Es madre soltera de cinco hijos, y uno de sus objetivos es mejorar su casa, el cual le hace falta hacer varias mejoras.

 Tiene comprado parte en materiales de construcción ya que desea hacer su cuarto de concreto para una mejor seguridad ante la delincuencia del barrio, así como mejorar su higiene, ya que es de zinc y aun de tierra. Comprara zinc, madera, clavos, arena, cemento para poder hacer este cambio que será de mucha sastifaccion en lo personal.
texts.en:
Martha is a hard working woman who works two jobs. In the morning she works as a caretaker in a private company and in the evenings she attends to her small business, selling snacks, in order to earn a better income because her salary is too low. She began with some of her savings. She is the single mother of five children, and one of her objectives is to upgrade her home, which needs several improvements. She has already bought some of the necessary building materials and she wants to build her room out of concrete to provide some security from the criminal element in her neighborhood, and make it more sanitary. It is currently made of sheet metal with a dirt floor. She still needs to buy zinc sheet metal, nails, sand, and cement in order to make this upgrade, which will be very satisfying to her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: Jaquelin, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en casa de su madre. Años atrás se inició en la venta de útiles escolares, pero no tuvo mucha acogida, de ahí recurrió en otro negocio, que es la venta de ropas usadas, pero su mayor inclinación fue la venta de muñecos de peluches, ya que son muy pocos los que vende este producto. Ahora los vende con mucha facilidad, ya que sus compradores fijos son aquellos que quieren obtener algún articulo para regalo, de esa manera logra obtener buenas rentas. Su esposo, en un inicio no tenia mucha fe de su trabajo, pero ahora, al verla contenta a Jaquelin, le apoya en sus compras. Lleva  5 años en este negocio y lo más difícil ha sido ganarse un espacio en el mercado, siendo informal hasta hoy en día. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP y sabe que le será muy útil, ya que así aumentará su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete así mismo y a sus compañeros en pagar las cuotas pendientes. Con este crédito, piensa invertirlo en la compra de más muñecos de peluches, por otro lado, desea ayudar a su esposo en comprarle una llanta para su motocarro.
texts.en:
Jaquelin is a hard-working mother who lives with her husband and three children in her mother's home. Years ago she began to sell school supplies, but did not have much success, so she turned to another business: the sale of used clothes. However, her greatest inclination was to sell stuffed animals, since very few people sell this product. She now makes a good income, successfully selling them to customers who buy them as gifts. Her husband did not initially have much faith in her work, but now that he sees how happy she is, he supports her purchases. She has been in this business for 5 years, and the most difficult aspect has been gaining a space in the market, as it has been informal up until now. This is her twelfth loan with MFP and she knows it will be very useful. It will increase her working capital. She promises that she will repay the instalments on time. She intends to invest this loan in the purchase of more stuffed animals, and on the other hand she wants to help her husband buy a tire for his motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up on stuffed animals

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.en:
Ana Gabriela is a 29-year-old mother of two who lives with her husband, children and a friend in her mother-in-law's house in Las Vegas del Tortuguero, located in Limón near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. Ana works on a farm owned by her mother-in-law. She is involved in the rearing and selling of pigs and chickens, and in catalogue sales. Her clients include neighbours and members of the larger community. An obstacle for Ana has been the water system which she uses to wash the pig pen. The pump and hoses often break down, making her task all the more difficult. This loan will be used to finance the purchase of one pig and to make reparations to the existing pig pen. Ana organizes her work day so that in the morning she tends to the animals, and in the afternoon she completes her household duties. Her main goal is to generate as much income as possible from pig, chicken and catalogue sales. She works so that (with the help of her husband) she will one day be able to move out of her mother-in-law´s house and into her own house.

The loan consultant that has been working with Ana describes her as an exceptionally hardworking mother. She undertakes her work with much enthusiasm because she has seen how the income she earns as a result of her productive activity contributes significantly to family well-being. Specifically, Ana has been able to make contributions to a savings account which she plans to use to finance the construction of a new house.

loans.use: To purchase a pig and repair the pig pen

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Noemi, ella tiene 22 años la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 2 añitos; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura y la ganadería, la socia también se dedica a criar animales menores (cuyes, conejos y aves de corral, gallinas, pollos). Nuestra socia también se dedica a la artesanía, ella teje a mano brazaletes y aquí está tejiendo precisamente uno de estas pulseras hechas de lana. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mayor número de animales menores y una pequeña vaquita. 

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Noemi belongs to the Colquecancha communal bank; she lives in the Raqchi community in Urubamba province, Cusco. She is 22 years old, lives with her partner and has a little one only 2 years old. She alternates her housework with agriculture and cattle farming. She also raises smaller animals (guinea pigs, rabbits, and fowl: hens and chickens). She also does handicrafts: she weaves bracelets by hand, and in the above picture she is intricately weaving a bracelet of wool. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of more small animals and a small calf. Noemi thanks everyone who is making her dream possible and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small animals and a calf

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Julia, de 52 años, es una madre de familia muy  trabajadora, es separada, y vive en su casa propia.Por las mañanas trabaja cuidando a una anciana,  y durante las  tardes, se dedica a la venta de  ropa  y  cosméticos de belleza. La modalidad de sus ventas las realiza  mediante pedidos, y sus  compradores son personas responsables en los  pagos, pues les brinda la mercadería a crédito. Julia está muy feliz con sus ventas, ya que le va muy bien en estos 8 años que lleva en el comercio. Inicialmente perdió su capital en este negocio,  por los créditos que brindó, y desde entonces, si tiene  clientes nuevos primero busca referencias para venderles con seguridad, o de lo contario les vende al contado. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar su capital  y después comprarse una vitrina donde pueda exhibir  su  mercadería.  Este es el  doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP,  y seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues desea tener nuevos créditos. En su grupo es un socia muy responsable y respetada.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de mercadería en ropa , para continuar progresando con  su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia, who is 52 years old, is a mother and very hardworking. She is separated and lives in her own house. In the mornings she takes care of an elderly woman. During the afternoons she sells clothing and cosmetics. She makes her sales through orders and her customers are people who are responsible in their payments—she sells merchandise to them on credit. Julia is very happy with her sales because they have been very good during the 8 years since she has had this business. At first she lost her capital in this business, because of the credit she extended to people. Since then, when she has new customers she first asks for references in order to sell to them with assurance, or she sells to them for cash up front. Her greatest wish is to increase her capital and then buy a vitrine where she can show her merchandise. This is the twelfth loan that she has had with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she will continue being punctual in her payments because she would like to have more loans in the future. In her group she is a very responsible and respected member. She plans to invest the requested money in buying clothing merchandise, so she can continue making progress with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy clothing merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Villasoria

texts.es: Villasoria, D. 57 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia con su esposo, sus dos hijos y una nieta. La actividad a la que se dedica Villasoria, es la venta D. productos nutricionales, así cómo también venD. extractos y jugos D. frutas frescas. Es muy reconocida en su barrio por su negocio  y su  buen carácter, siendo sus compradores son los comerciantes del mercado aledaño a su domicilio y eso le permite estar al pendiente D. su hija, que sufre D. retardo mental. Se siente muy feliz por la clientela que tiene  ya que eso le genera buenas ganancias. Lleva 8 años en esta actividad, por lo que espera mas adelante ampliar su negocio y con el paso del tiempo instalar una fuente D. soda en su casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que este crédito le será D. mucha ayuda, por ello se compromete pagar sus cuotas  y D. ese modo no defraudar al grupo, que la invito a ser parte D. ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprarse una licuadora y cafetera, asimismo insumos para preparar sus alimentos nutricionales.
texts.en:
Villasoria, age 57, is a hard-working mother who lives with her husband, two children and one granddaughter in her own house. She sells nutritional products as well as extracts and fresh fruit juice. She is well-known in her neighbourhood for her business and her good character. Her buyers are merchants in the market near her home; this allows her to devote herself to her daughter, who suffers from mental illness. She is very happy with her clientele, who already proviD. her with good profits. She has been doing this work for 8 years, and she hopes to soon expand her business and to install a soda fountain in her house in the future. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that it will be a big help. For this reason she promises to repay on time and not disappoint her group. With the requested loan, she will buy a blender and a coffee maker, as well as ingredients to prepare her nutritional foods.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a blender, coffee maker and ingredients

loans.name: Muyurina Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Muyurina inicia su ciclo 19 con 18 socias, que son D. la comunidad D. Muyurina que se encuentra a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, es un valle pequeño y la mayoría D. sus pobladores se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras.
Raquel es la presidenta del Banco Comunal y durante el tiempo que esta en su Banco aprendió valores y ahorrar, Raquel es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos D. 8, 6 años, vive en la casa D. sus suegros y su mayor sueño es construir su casa para lo cual ya esta ahorrando en su Banco Comunal. Raquel junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura D. verduras como lechuga, culantro, para lo cual arriendan terrenos pues no tiene terreno propio, sus productos los transporta a la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. lo comercializa al por mayor en el mercado D. abastos. Además Raquel cría animales como gallina, cerdo que venD. en su misma comunidad. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. abono y semilla.
texts.en:
The communal bank Muyurina begins its 19 cycle with 18 members from the community of Muyurina, located about 20 minutes outsiD. of Ayacucho. Muyurina sits in a small valley and most of its residents work growing vegetables. Raquel is now the president of the communal bank, and during her time with the bank she's learned about values and saving. Raquel is 34 years old, and married with 2 children ages 6 and 8. They live in the home of her inlaws. Raquel's dream is be able to construct their own home, which is why she is saving with the communal bank. Together with her husband, Raquel works cultivating lettuce and cilantro, though they do not have their own land. Their products are then transported to the city of Ayacucho where they are sold wholesale in the market. Raquel also raises animals such as hens and pigs, which she sells in the community. Her loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Margot Ynes

texts.es: Ines tiene 37 años de edad es soltera vive en la casa de su madre, ella presta servcio como cajera para el chifa Quan Xin ubicado en el distrito de Parcona  en la calle Pachacutec yupanqui, ella viene laborando hace 3 años consecutivamnete en este negocio, ella es una persona joven con muchos sueños y objetivos, uno de ellos es poder tener su casa y negocio propio, con el dinero que solicita invertira en algunos gastos personales.
texts.en:
Ines is 37 years old. She is single and lives in her mother’s house. She works as a cashier at the Quan Xin Chinese restaurant, located in the Parcona district, on Pachacutec Yupanqui street. She has been working for 3 consecutive years at this business. She is a young person with many dreams and goals. One of them is to own a house and her own business. She will use the money she is requesting for some personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses

loans.name: Sancuanjoche Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sancuanjoche está integrado por tres féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y decididas una de ellas es Sonia H. Álvarez quien tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace cinco años. Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 12 y 7 años  y un bebe de 11 meses.
 Sus compañeras de grupo son Juliana Catalina A. quien vende cosméticos desde hace doce años y Jennifer Avellán vende ropa. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Sancuanjoche group is comprised of three hard-working, enterprising, and dedicated women. One of them is Sonia H. Álvarez. She has had a small mini-market for five years. She has four children; 19 years old, 12 years old, 7 years old, and an 11 month old baby. Her colleague in the group, Juliana Catalina A., has been selling cosmetics for 12 years. Her other colleague, Jennifer Avellán, sells clothes. They will use the loan in their businesses to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic grains, meat, and soaps, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Vilma, ella tiene 35 años la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella compra y vende productos secos en Urubamba en el mercado central; el esposo de nuestra socia trabaja en la agricultura y la socia también se dedica a criar animales menores (cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral, gallinas y pollos). Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos para llevar a abastecer su stand en el mercado en Urubamba.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Colquecancha communal bank; she lives in the community of Raqchi, Urubamba province, Cusco. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. She does housework and works in the retail trade. She buys and sells dry goods in Urubamba at the central market. Her husband works in agriculture and she also takes care of small animals (guinea pigs, pigs and fowl: hens and chickens). Vilma is requesting this loan to invest in dry goods to stock her stand in the Urubamba market. She thanks all of the investors who are making this dream possible, and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry goods for the market

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, D.  60 años, es una madre muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su esposo y  sus 3 hijos mayores.Se dedica a  la venta D. bocadillos  por las tardes. Es experta en freír  picarones (dulce hecho a base D.  harina, camote, zapallo y  levadura). Cada día trabaja en busca D. vender todos sus picarones,  ya que D. ese modo sus utilidades son buenas. Años atrás vendía en la puerta D. su casa, lo que  no  era muy rentable, y en la actualidad  venD. en un paradero y sus compradores son las personas que  esperan y bajan D. los buses, y eso le es muy beneficioso, ya que esta obteniendo buenas ganancias. Está contenta con lo que hace, porque le da tiempo para vender  diferentes productos D. belleza, y tiene planeado construir más cuartos en su casa, para que en el futuro pueda vivir D. sus rentas.Este es su doceavo préstamo con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso, es por ello que se compromete en  seguir pagando sus cuotas como siempre lo ha hecho. Alicia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra  D. insumos para la preparación D. sus picarones, asimismo tiene pensado invertir en el incremento D. cosméticos para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 60, is a very hard-working and responsible mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and 3 grown children. She sells sandwiches in the afternoon. She is an expert in frying picarones (sweets maD. from flour, sweet potato, pumpkin and yeast). Every day she works to sell all of her picarones, and so her profits are good. Years ago she sold them out of her house, which was not very profitable, so she now sells her food at a bus station and serves people waiting for buses and just arriving. This is very profitable and she is making a good income. She is happy with her work, because it also gives her time to sell beauty products. She plans to build more rooms in her house, and in the future to rent them and live off of that income. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she knows that it will be very helpful. For this reason she promises to continue to pay her instalments on time as she always has. Alicia plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of ingredients for her picarones, and she is also thinking about investing in more cosmetics to continue selling them.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Como La Águilas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Como las Águilas está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Flora de María A. Domínguez quien inicio vendiendo nacatamales y enchiladas hace dos años y actualmente vende también leña y maní con la ayuda de sus hijos de 24, 14 y 11 años.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Yadira del Carmen Sabala quien empezó comercializando ropa luego invirtió en cosméticos y actualmente piensa introducirse al rubro de calzado; Mercedes P. quien destaza cerdo y realiza nacatamales y Mariela O. M. quien vende carne de res, hueso, enchiladas y realiza nacatamales.
texts.en:
The “Como las Águilas” group is comprised of four hard-working women. One of them is Flora de María A. Domínguez. She started selling “nacatamales” (popular steamed corn cakes) and enchiladas two years ago. She currently also sells firewood and peanuts with help from her children. They are 24, 14, and 11 years old. Yadira del Carmen Sabala, a colleague in the group, started selling clothes. Then she invested in cosmetics. She is currently planning on starting in the area of footwear. Mercedes P., another colleague in the group, butchers pigs and makes nacatamales. Mariela O. M., also a colleague, sells pork, bones, and enchiladas. She makes nacatamales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn, pork, basic grains, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Percy Fredy

texts.es: Percy tiene 28 años de edad, el es soltero vieve en la casa de sus padres quienes son separados. El se dedica al alquiler de su vehiculo, cuenta con un automovil tico , lo adquirio  con capital propio, el se inicio como comerciante de la compara y venta de frutas, actualmente realiza esa actividad solo por temporada de cosecha de uva o mango. El es un joven con muchos sueños uno de ellos es poder tener mas vehiculo. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en la conversion de gas a su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Percy is 28 years old, single, and lives in the home of his parents, who are separated. He has a business renting his vehicle. He has a Daewoo Tico automobile, which he acquired with his own capital. He started out as a fruit merchant; he now carries out this activity only during the harvest season for grapes and mangoes. He is a youth who has many dreams; one of these is to be able to have another vehicle. With the money he requests he will invest in converting his vehicle so that it can run on natural gas.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to convert his vehicle to natural gas

loans.name: Liboria

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Liboria, ella tiene 47 años la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijo; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia trabaja vendiendo artesanía en el mirador de Raqchy, la socia junto a otras señoras socias venden en este punto turístico todo tipo de artesanías, ella compra lanas de diferentes colores y diseña diversos animales y paisajes imitando el lenguaje antiguo de los Inkas cuando utilizaban la iconográfica como medio de lenguaje popular. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar material y elaborar sus tejidos, una parte para su casa y otra para comprar un animalito vacuno aún no sabe que comprará si torito o vaca.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Liboria, age 47, belongs to the Colquecancha community bank; she lives in the community of Raqchi, Urubamba province, Cusco. She is married and has 4 sons. She does housework and retail; she sells handicrafts in the Raqchi viewpoint. She sells all sorts of handicrafts in this tourist spot, along with other bank members. She buys different coloured wools and designs a wide range of animals and landscapes, and in doing so she imitates the ancient language of the Incas, who used iconography as a form of common language. Liboria is requesting this loan to buy material and develop her weaving, work on her house and buy a small animal, either a bull or a cow. She is grateful to everyone who is making this dream possible an promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weaving material, an animal and housing materials

loans.name: Michael Group

texts.es:
El grupo Michael está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas Agne Janett A. José, coordinadora del grupo quien desde 1990 vende y produce artesanías. Ella administra el establecimiento y las finanzas mientras su esposo trabaja en la producción de artesanías de madera. 
A. invertirá el crédito en materiales para el taller y en la compra de artesanías para el local con la meta de algún día exportar sus productos.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Rebeca V. G. quien tiene una pequeña venta y realiza artesanías en madera y Carmen Idalia C. H. quien tiene trabaja con video juegos desde hace aproximadamente un año.
texts.en:
The group "Michael" is made up of 3 enterprising and hardworking women. One of these is Agne Janett A. José, who has been the coordinator of the group since 1990, and who makes and sells handicrafts. She manages the establishment and finances, while her husband works in the production of wooden handicrafts. A. will invest the loan in materials for the workshop and in the purchase of handicrafts for the store, with the goal of some day exporting her products. Her fellow group members are Rebeca V. G., who has a small store and makes wooden handicrafts, and Carmen Idalia C. H., who has been working selling video games for approximately a year.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to make wooden and other handicrafts

loans.name: Cien Flores Group

texts.es:
Cien Flores es un grupo conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que desde muy jóvenes han salido a ganarse el pan de cada día. Una de ellas es Ana Lorena L. H. quien desde los 16 años empezó a trabajar realizando tortillas para sacar adelante a sus pequeños de 10 y 9 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de materia prima para este producto tan demandado por la población.

Sus compañeras son Marisol del Rosario G. quien comercializa ropa usada y Ayde G. quien desde hace 10 años tiene una comideria y refresquería. Ellas invertirán el préstamo en sus negocios para acrecentarlos.
texts.en:
Cien Flores is a group of three hardworking women who have been earning a living since they were very young. One of their members is Ana Lorena L. H., who has been making tortillas since she was 16 to feed her children, who are now 9 and 10 years old. She will invest the money in buying raw materials to make this popular food. Her colleagues are Marisol del Rosario G., who sells second-hand clothing, and Ayde G., who has had a food and beverage business for the last 10 years. They will use the loan to increase their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and wood and milling

loans.name: Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cayetano está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas pertenecientes del barrio Las Torres. La coordinadora del grupo es  Carmen A. quien vende frutas y verduras en el M. de Masaya. Ella inicio en este negocio desde pequeña ya que su madre se dedica a esto y desde hace cuatro años se independizó.
 Además en la casa vende frescos y chiverías negocio en el que sus hijos le ayudan. A. invertirá especialmente en frijoles, maíz, arroz y papa entre otros productos.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Mayra M. F. quien tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace cuatro año y la cual surtirá en granos básicos y Pabla T. que tiene tres años de ganarse la vida haciendo tortillas el bastimento de preferencia de los nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
This group consists of three hardworking and enterprising women from the neighborhood of Las Torres in Masaya, Nicaragua. The group's coordinator is Carmen A., who sells fruits and vegetables at Masaya's market. She has been involved in this business since she was small, working with her mother, but has been independent for the last four years. She also sells drinks and other products out of her home, with the help of her children. A. will buy beans, corn, rice, and potatoes, among other things. The other members of the group are Mayra Molinares F., who has had a small general store for the last four years, and Paula T., who for the last three years has earned a living making tortillas, a favorite staple of Nicaraguans.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, corn, rice, and potatoes

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Teófila tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de La  Victoria, un distrito próximo a la ciudad de Chiclayo, conocido por ser uno de los mas poblados de la región.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la venta de flores en el mercado de la ciudad de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de viaje del lugar en donde vive. Ella va al mencionado centro de abasto todos los dias para ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de flores que suelen utilizarse para diversas ocasiones. Para mantener su negocio ella siempre suele ofrecer flores frescas y un buen trato a sus clientes, las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad las utiliza para apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar.

Teófila desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas flores de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias con las cuales su familia pueda seguir progresando, para lograr su objetivo ella ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Teófila es una mujer amable y que gusta mucho de su trabajo, ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas, por lo que es cobsiderada como una exelente cliente.
texts.en:
Teofila is 47 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and their children in the district of La Victoria, near the city of Chiclayo and known to be one of the most populated districts of the region. She has worked for more than two years selling flowers in the market of the city of Cayaltí, located about an hour's journey from where she lives. She goes to this wholesale market every day to offer to her clients a wide variety of flowers that they frequently use for various occasions. To maintain her business she always makes sure to offer fresh flowers and good service to her clients. The earnings she receives from this work are used to help her husband in maintaining their household. Teofila wants to expand her business with the purchase of more flowers so that she can increase her sales and receive increased earnings with which her family can continue progressing. To achieve this goal she has requested a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Teofila is a friendly woman who likes her work a lot. She has worked before with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in her payments, for which she is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy in season flowers to expand her business of selling flowers.

loans.name: Ma. Gertrudes

texts.en: Ma. Gertrudes B. is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Capinyahan, Bais City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by engaging in a general store, pig fattening, and an ambulatory business of ready-to-wear clothes and dry goods. Her 51-year-old husband, Nestor, is a government employee. They have three children who are between 11 and 22 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Ma. Gertrudes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her three businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 40,000 from her business activities. Ma. Gertrudes is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and ambulatory business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and on her family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 10,000 as her 11th loan, which she intends to use on her general store. Ma. Gertrudes is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Vesitacion

texts.en: Vesitacion P., 55 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by engaging in selling spices and vegetables. She lives on Aglipay St., Bais City, Negros Oriental with her husband and their six children who are between 12 and 32 years old. Vesitacion is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business selling spices and vegetables, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 45,000. Vesitacion is now borrowing Php 19,500 so that she can continue her selling of spices and vegetables. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Vesitacion aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime L. is a 54-year-old married man who supports his family through his fishing business. He lives in So. Lag-it, Bgry Capinyahan, Bais City, Negros Oriental with his wife and their 13-year-old child who is currently in school.
Jaime has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved his living conditions with the help of his loans from NWTF and through his own efforts. By working hard in his fishing business, he is gradually making his family more economically stable. He now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP.
Jaime is now borrowing 10,000 PHP to repair his fishing boat. This will be his fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. His previous loan of 10,000, PHP, which he paid off well within its term, was just another step in his journey towards economic freedom. Jaime aspires to elevate his family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen L. is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Gapang Poblacion, Sta. Catalina, Negros Oriental. Aileen has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for ten years now and earns a living by running a food vending/rice retailing business.
With a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF, Aileen is purchasing a solar lantern to extend her productive hours and, at the same time, cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save its clients money. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. Families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes. The solar lantern offers a free, environmentally-friendly renewable source of energy, which allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lantern

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in P. Villanueva St., Sta. Catalina, Negros Oriental. Jocelyn has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for three years now and earns a living by running a sewing business.
Jocelyn is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and, at the same time, cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save its clients money. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. Families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes. The solar lantern offers a free, environmentally-friendly renewable source of energy, which allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lantern

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar B. is from the village of San Jose. He is 39 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Oscar owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP whenever he sells his harvested rice.
In 2006, Oscar joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his eighth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina N. is from the village of San Jose. She is 38 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Merlina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 32,000 PHP per harvest.
In 2006, Merlina joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina Q. is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Olympia, Bais City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by fishing, fish vending and pig fattening. Justina’s 55-year-old husband, Wilfredo, is a fisherman, and they have five children who are between 13 and 30 years old. Justina is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP was used to fund the operation of her fishing business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing 18,000 PHP for her 14th loan, which she intends to use on fishing, fish vending and pig fattening. Justina is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma S. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling products like dried fish and shrimp in the local community. She also sells vegetables and spices. Alma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell and for working capital. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Charles Edin

texts.es:
Charles tiene 30 años de edad,es soltero y no tiene hijos, alquila un cuarto en la ciudad de Cayaltí. El es huérfano desde temprana edad, es descendiente de la tribu Aguaruna (tribu de la selva peruana). Sus padres murieron a manos de terroristas, el es una de las tantas victimas que dejó en nuestro país el terrible movimiento subersivo que tomo parte en nuestro país durante la década del ochenta.

Charles nos comenta que recibió educación por parte del estado, llegó a estudiar incluso un curso de computación e informática. Actualmente se dedica a vender frutas frescas y artículos de plástico en el mercado de la ciudad de Cayaltí. Esta actividad le provee de ingresos para subsistir.

Charles desea adquirir mas productos plásticos para ampliar su negocio y alquilar un puesto en el mercado de Cayalti, de modo que pueda trabajar de modo mas tranquilo y estable. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles.

Charles es una persona honesta y luchadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para progresar. En la zona donde vive se ha sabido ganar el cariño y respeto de sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo.
texts.en:
Charles is a single man of 30 years with no children, and he rents a room in the town of Cayaltí. He has been an orphan since he was young and is a member of the Aguaruna tribe (a tribe from the Peruvian forest). His parents were killed by terrorists; he is one of Peru's many victims of the terrible guerrilla conflict during the 1980s. Charles's education was paid for by the state, and he was able to study as far as a computer and IT course. He now sells fresh fruit and plastic hardware at Cayaltí's market. He derives his income from this work. Charles wants to buy more plastic hardware to increase the size of his business and to rent a stall in Cayaltí's market so that he can have a calmer and more stable life. He has therefore asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 300 new soles. Charles is an honest and enterprising man, and his greatest wish is to get ahead as a businessman. In the area where he lives, he has gained the lvoe and respect of his neighbors and colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic hardware to increase his business.

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 45 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the eighth loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
Carlos Arauz Mena  es un señor de 36 años de edad la cual vive con sus padres y un hijo y sus padres en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.
	 
Desde muy joven don Carlos se ha dedicado a la ganadería, de esta forma ha mantenido a su familia. Comenta que tiene ya muchos años de estar en este proyecto por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda y la instrucción adecuada. Dice que se siente muy orgulloso ya que ha visto como poco a poco ha salido adelante.  

Don Carlos desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢629,000 (seiscientos veintinueve  mil colones) para comprar más terneros y poder hacer crecer  su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante y ofrecerle a sus padres quienes se encuentran ya muy ancianos las mejores condiciones de vida

Don Carlos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a widow with two adult children. When her husband died working in a coal mine, she needed to generate income herself to raise her children. Olga moved to another town and started a small business selling clothing. She has been in this business now for eight years. The business is working well, she has a good location and many customers who keep returning.
Olga would like to purchase a second location for her business. She needs to borrow 10,000 UAH to do so. She is going to create a workplace for her daughter to allow her to generate income for her own family.

loans.use: To purchase a second business location

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona García González  es una señora de 57 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos y sus padres en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde niña doña Petrona se levantaba todos los dias a las 4 am de la mañana para poder ordeñar las vacas de su familia.  Por lo que la lechería ha sido parte de su vida siempre. Asegura que en su comunidad hay bastante demanda la leche que producen sus vacas puesto que le ha servido siempre para mantener a su familia. A pesar de eso ella asegura que con mas vacas podría aumentar la producción y así sacar más provecho de sus habilidades. 

Es por eso que doña  Petrona desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢662,000 (seiscientos sesenta y dos  mil colones) para comprar 3 vacas mas  y poder hacer crecer  su negocio y ofrecerle una mejor vida a sus hijos.

Doña Petrona  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Petrona García González is 57 years old and lives with her husband, her two children, and her parents in a village called Hernández located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province, Costa Rica. This village is in a mountainous region with impressive views, a humid climate, and along the highway near the country's northern border. Its main economic activities are cattle and agriculture, specifically the farming of grains, tubers, and oranges. Since she was a child, Petrona has gotten up at 4 am every day to milk her family's cows. Dairy farming has always been a part of her life. In her village, there is plenty of demand for the milk she produces, and she has always been able to feed her family. Nevertheless, she would like to buy more cows to increase her production and thereby make more use of skills. For this reason, Petrona has asked for 662,000 colones ($1,200) to buy three more cows so that she can expand her business and offer her children a better life. Doña Petrona is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, one of 100 organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan. She is thankful for this type of microfinance and credit organizations for giving her access to the financial services that will allow her to dedicate more time to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is from the village of Brgy. Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old and single. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Marilyn joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married with three adult children. He runs a small business selling and fitting new windows in new houses as well as old. Many people change windows in old houses to save heat in winter, which is why there is still high demand. Mykola started this business 14 years ago.
Mykola is a very responsible and honest person. People enjoy doing business with him and recommend him to others. He has many customers and his business is going well. Mykola would like to borrow 7,500 UAH to purchase inventory. His goal is to develop his business further.

To make a living, Cynthia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling food and daily-use products in the local community. Cynthia has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Cynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Cynthia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Mogata

texts.en:
Mogata is 30 years old, married and the father of four children. He is a farmer from Kisii, in Western Kenya. 

He has been farming for over seven years.  His main crops are tea, nappier grass and maize which he sells at the local market to provide for his family. 

Mogata recently cleared his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.35,000 and has requested this loan for KES.60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will enable him earn enough income to pay school fees for his children and to provide enough milk for his family. 

In five years' time, he hopes to own at least three high quality dairy cows that produce 20 liters of milk daily.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nene

texts.fr: Madame Nene D. est une femme mariée de 46 ans, mère de 7 enfants  et qui évolue dans le commerce de produits locaux, biscuits et bonbons. Elle a une expérience de 7 mois dans son activité. Elle est membre de la caisse  de Ouakam  depuis 4 ans et a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Elle a choisi cette activité de commerce dans le but d’éviter le chômage mais aussi dans le but d’assister sa famille et de subvenir a certains besoins de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destine a l’achat de produits en provenance du Mali en vue d’accroitre son stock.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nene D., age 46, is the mother of seven children. For seven months, she's been selling local products, such as biscuits and candies. She's been a member of the Ouakam savings institution for four years and already benefited from one previous loan. She chose her business in order to escape unemployment, but also to assist her family and provide for some of her children's needs. She's seeking a new loan of XOF 300'000 in order to buy products coming from Mali, so as to increase her stock.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital and purchase products

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Yacine D. est une technicienne de surface de 31 ans qui est membre de la caisse de Ouakam depuis 8 ans. Mais parallèlement elle évolue dans le commerce de cosmétiques et d’autres produits.  Elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans son activité qu’elle a héritée de sa famille. La raison de son choix est sa volonté d’augmenter ses revenus. Son objectif est de faire face aux besoins de sa famille et surtout de soutenir sa maman.  Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus dans son activité c’est la rapidité de la vente et sa capacité de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs en vue d’acheter des marchandises pour augmenter son stock et élargir sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Miss Yacine D. is a 31-year old cleaner, who has been a member of the Ouakam savings bank for the past eight years. At the same time, however, she is developing an activity selling cosmetics and other products. She has two years' experience in her activity, which she has inherited from her family. The reason for her choice is the desire to increase her income. Her objective is to provide for her family's needs and above all to support her mother. What interests her most in her activity is the rapidity of her sales and her capacity to meet customer needs. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs in order to buy goods, increase her stock and expand her customer base.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital
